data_tapor: {"id":940,"user_id":1,"name":"Advene","detail":"\u003cp\u003eThe cross-platform Advene application allows users to easily create comments and analyses of video documents, through the definition of time-aligned annotations and their mobilisation into\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eautomatically-generated or user-written comment views (HTML documents). Annotations can also be used to modify the rendition of the audiovisual document, thus providing virtual montage, captioning, navigation... capabilities. Users can exchange their comments/analyses in the form of Advene packages, independently from the video itself.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe Advene framework provides models and tools allowing to design and reuse annotations schemas; annotate video streams according to these schemas; generate and create Stream-Time Based (mainly video-centred) or User-Time Based (mainly text-centred) visualisations of the annotations. Schemas (annotation- and relation-types), annotations and relations, queries and views can be clustered and shared in units called packages. Hypervideo documents are generated when needed, both from packages (for annotation and view description) and DVDs (audiovisual streams).\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/1/940.jpg","creators_name":"LIRIS","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://advene.org/","last_updated":"2018-10-05","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/1/940-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: The cross-platform Advene application allows users to easily create comments and analyses of video documents, through the definition of time-aligned annotations and their mobilisation intoautomatically-generated or user-written comment views (HTML documents). Annotations can also be used to modify the rendition of the audiovisual document, thus providing virtual montage, captioning, navigation... capabilities. Users can exchange their comments/analyses in the form of Advene packages, independently from the video itself.The Advene framework provides models and tools allowing to design and reuse annotations schemas; annotate video streams according to these schemas; generate and create Stream-Time Based (mainly video-centred) or User-Time Based (mainly text-centred) visualisations of the annotations. Schemas (annotation- and relation-types), annotations and relations, queries and views can be clustered and shared in units called packages. Hypervideo documents are generated when needed, both from packages (for annotation and view description) and DVDs (audiovisual streams).
name: Advene

data_tapor: {"id":955,"user_id":1,"name":"CiteULike","detail":"\u003cp\u003eCiteULike is a free service to help you to store, organise and share the scholarly papers you are reading. When you see a paper on the web that interests you, you can click one button and have it added to your personal library. CiteULike automatically extracts the citation details, so there's no need to type them in yourself. It all works from within your web browser so you can access it from any computer with an Internet connection. CiteULike supports annotation and rating of items, and upload of attachments (e.g. PDF file). (Attachments are only accessible privately by individual users). Bibliographic entries can be imported singly or in batches using BibTex or RIS formats.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/1/955.jpg","creators_name":"Richard Cameron","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www.citeulike.org/","last_updated":"2018-10-19","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/1/955-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: CiteULike is a free service to help you to store, organise and share the scholarly papers you are reading. When you see a paper on the web that interests you, you can click one button and have it added to your personal library. CiteULike automatically extracts the citation details, so there's no need to type them in yourself. It all works from within your web browser so you can access it from any computer with an Internet connection. CiteULike supports annotation and rating of items, and upload of attachments (e.g. PDF file). (Attachments are only accessible privately by individual users). Bibliographic entries can be imported singly or in batches using BibTex or RIS formats.
name: CiteULike

data_tapor: {"id":956,"user_id":1,"name":"Archivematica","detail":"\u003cp\u003eArchivematica is a digital preservation system that is designed to maintain standards-based, long-term access to collections of digital objects. It uses a micro-services design pattern to provide an integrated suite of software tools that allows users to process digital objects from ingest to access in compliance with the ISO-OAIS functional model. Users monitor and control the micro-services via a web-based dashboard. Archivematica uses METS, PREMIS, Dublin Core and other best practice metadata standards. Archivematica implements media type preservation plans based on an analysis of the significant characteristics of file formats.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/1/956.jpg","creators_name":"Artefactual Systems","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"http://www.artefactual.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.archivematica.org/en/","last_updated":"2018-10-12","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/artefactual/archivematica","thumb_url":"images/tools/1/956-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Archivematica is a digital preservation system that is designed to maintain standards-based, long-term access to collections of digital objects. It uses a micro-services design pattern to provide an integrated suite of software tools that allows users to process digital objects from ingest to access in compliance with the ISO-OAIS functional model. Users monitor and control the micro-services via a web-based dashboard. Archivematica uses METS, PREMIS, Dublin Core and other best practice metadata standards. Archivematica implements media type preservation plans based on an analysis of the significant characteristics of file formats.
name: Archivematica

data_tapor: {"id":957,"user_id":1,"name":"HyperImage","detail":"\u003cp\u003eThe HyperImage platform supports the linking of (audio)-visual objects, texts and mixed-media documents. References between images in total, regions of images, annotations regarding the images, and other media, are achieved by means of hyperlinks.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe HyperImage Authoring System is a web-based system consisting of three main components – server, connector and database – on to which the graphic frontend (the HyperImage Editor) is built. Data is exchanged between the HyperImage Editor and the HyperImage Server using standardised methods via SOAP/HTTP.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/missing.jpg","creators_name":"Humboldt University Berlin, Leuphana University Luneberg","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":null,"nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/missing-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: The HyperImage platform supports the linking of (audio)-visual objects, texts and mixed-media documents. References between images in total, regions of images, annotations regarding the images, and other media, are achieved by means of hyperlinks.The HyperImage Authoring System is a web-based system consisting of three main components – server, connector and database – on to which the graphic frontend (the HyperImage Editor) is built. Data is exchanged between the HyperImage Editor and the HyperImage Server using standardised methods via SOAP/HTTP.
name: hyperimage

data_tapor: {"id":959,"user_id":1,"name":"WorldMap","detail":"\u003cp\u003eWorldMap is a web-based map collaboration platform hosted at Harvard, which allows anyone to store, organize, visualize, edit, collaborate, and publish geospatial information. Upload your own map layers or use maps others have contributed. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe system attempts to fill the growing gap between powerful desktop-bound mapping applications, and lightweight web map solutions with limited storage capacity.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/1/959.jpg","creators_name":"Center for Geographic Analysis, Harvard University","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":null,"nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/1/959-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: WorldMap is a web-based map collaboration platform hosted at Harvard, which allows anyone to store, organize, visualize, edit, collaborate, and publish geospatial information. Upload your own map layers or use maps others have contributed. The system attempts to fill the growing gap between powerful desktop-bound mapping applications, and lightweight web map solutions with limited storage capacity.
name: WorldMap

detail: WARCreate is a Google Chrome extension that allows a user to create a Web ARChive (WARC) file from any browseable webpage. The resulting files can then be used with other tools like the Internet Archive's open source Wayback Machine. The tool is an evolving product with the end result pushing toward being a personal web archiving solution for those that wish to securely archive their metadata in a standardize way.
name: WARCreate

data_tapor: {"id":962,"user_id":1,"name":"Tesseract","detail":"\u003cp\u003eCombined with the Leptonica Image Processing Library Tesseract can read a wide variety of image formats and convert them to text in over 40 languages.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis code is a raw OCR engine. It has no output formatting and no UI. It can detect fixed pitch vs proportional text. Nevertheless in 1995 this engine was in the top 3 in terms of character accuracy, and it compiles and runs on both Linux and Windows. Training code is included in the open source release.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe core developer on the project is Ray Smith (theraysmith).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThomas Breuel (tmbdev) and Ilya Mezhirov (mezhirov) work on the OCRopus project, for which Tesseract is one of the pluggable OCR engines; OCRopus also provides layout analysis and statistical language modeling.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMost of the work on Tesseract is sponsored by Google.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/1/962.jpg","creators_name":"HP Labs, Google","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract","last_updated":"2018-10-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/1/962-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Combined with the Leptonica Image Processing Library Tesseract can read a wide variety of image formats and convert them to text in over 40 languages.This code is a raw OCR engine. It has no output formatting and no UI. It can detect fixed pitch vs proportional text. Nevertheless in 1995 this engine was in the top 3 in terms of character accuracy, and it compiles and runs on both Linux and Windows. Training code is included in the open source release.The core developer on the project is Ray Smith (theraysmith).Thomas Breuel (tmbdev) and Ilya Mezhirov (mezhirov) work on the OCRopus project, for which Tesseract is one of the pluggable OCR engines; OCRopus also provides layout analysis and statistical language modeling.Most of the work on Tesseract is sponsored by Google.
name: Tesseract

data_tapor: {"id":973,"user_id":1,"name":"Google Drive","detail":"\u003cp\u003eAvailable as a web-based service and as an app for iOS, Mac, PC, and Android, Google Drive allows users to create, store, edit, and share files across all their devices. Online and offline file access available. Requires a Google account for use, but allows files from Drive to be shared with non-Google users. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eDrive allows users to upload, store, and share any type of file (e.g., JPEG, MP4, JS, INDD, AI). The majority can be previewed, and many can be edited within Drive. Some files (e.g., DOCX, XLSX, PPTX) can be converted into compatible file types for editing, commenting, and more. Drive is the platform for Google Sheets, Docs, Slides, and many other approved applications. Files saved in Drive sync to all other devices, with an activity monitor that can be useful for version control (see what edits have been made and when, and revert back to previous instances if needed). \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOffers both free and paid accounts, priced by data capacity: 15 GB (free), 100 GB ($1.99/month), 1 TB ($9.99/month), 10 TB ($99.99/month), 20 TB ($199.99/month), 30 TB ($299.99/month). Teams with more than five people can purchase unlimited storage for $10/user/month.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/1/973.jpg","creators_name":"Google","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.google.ca/drive/","last_updated":"2018-10-12","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/1/973-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Available as a web-based service and as an app for iOS, Mac, PC, and Android, Google Drive allows users to create, store, edit, and share files across all their devices. Online and offline file access available. Requires a Google account for use, but allows files from Drive to be shared with non-Google users. Drive allows users to upload, store, and share any type of file (e.g., JPEG, MP4, JS, INDD, AI). The majority can be previewed, and many can be edited within Drive. Some files (e.g., DOCX, XLSX, PPTX) can be converted into compatible file types for editing, commenting, and more. Drive is the platform for Google Sheets, Docs, Slides, and many other approved applications. Files saved in Drive sync to all other devices, with an activity monitor that can be useful for version control (see what edits have been made and when, and revert back to previous instances if needed). Offers both free and paid accounts, priced by data capacity: 15 GB (free), 100 GB ($1.99/month), 1 TB ($9.99/month), 10 TB ($99.99/month), 20 TB ($199.99/month), 30 TB ($299.99/month). Teams with more than five people can purchase unlimited storage for $10/user/month.
name: Google Drive

data_tapor: {"id":975,"user_id":1,"name":"GRASS GIS","detail":"\u003cp\u003eGRASS GIS is free and open source software used for geospatial data management and analysis, image processing, graphics/maps production, spatial modeling, and visualization. GRASS is currently used in academic and commercial settings around the world, as well as by many governmental agencies and environmental consulting companies. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eComparison to QGIS: Like GRASS, QGIS is free, open source, developed by volunteers, and has a robust and active online user community. However, GRASS is mainly used for highly technical purposes and mathematical analyses. For more details, see this  Stack Exchange  thread.  QGIS and GRASS do cooperate with each other; Plug-ins and extensions allow GRASS functions to be used inside QGIS.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/1/975.jpg","creators_name":"Open Source Geospatial Foundation","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":null,"nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/1/975-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: GRASS GIS is free and open source software used for geospatial data management and analysis, image processing, graphics/maps production, spatial modeling, and visualization. GRASS is currently used in academic and commercial settings around the world, as well as by many governmental agencies and environmental consulting companies. Comparison to QGIS: Like GRASS, QGIS is free, open source, developed by volunteers, and has a robust and active online user community. However, GRASS is mainly used for highly technical purposes and mathematical analyses. For more details, see this  Stack Exchange  thread.  QGIS and GRASS do cooperate with each other; Plug-ins and extensions allow GRASS functions to be used inside QGIS.
name: GRASS GIS

detail: Timemap.js is a Javascript library that helps you to produce online maps (such as Google, OpenLayers, and Bing) along with a SIMILE timeline. You can load one or more datasets (in JSON, KML, or GeoRSS) onto both a map and a timeline simultaneously. By default, only items in the visible range of the timeline are displayed on the map.

data_tapor: {"id":996,"user_id":1,"name":"Blacklight","detail":"\u003cp\u003eBlacklight is an open source Ruby on Rails gem that provides a discovery interface for any Solr index. Blacklight provides a default user interface which is customizable via the standard Rails (templating) mechanisms. Blacklight accommodates heterogeneous data, allowing different information displays for different types of objects and features faceted browsing, relevance based searching, bookmarkable items, permanent URLs for every item, and user tagging of items.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/1/996.jpg","creators_name":"University of Virginia Library","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://projectblacklight.org/","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/projectblacklight/blacklight","thumb_url":"images/tools/1/996-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Blacklight is an open source Ruby on Rails gem that provides a discovery interface for any Solr index. Blacklight provides a default user interface which is customizable via the standard Rails (templating) mechanisms. Blacklight accommodates heterogeneous data, allowing different information displays for different types of objects and features faceted browsing, relevance based searching, bookmarkable items, permanent URLs for every item, and user tagging of items.
name: Blacklight

data_tapor:
{"id":997,"user_id":1,"name":"Indexhibit","detail":"

A web application used to build and maintain an archetypal, invisible website format that combines text, image, movie and sound.

What is it?

Indexhibit is a pioneering CMS web application founded in 2006 which is used to create websites in the established index + exhibit format.

The Indexhibit format has become archetypal for the creative community, combining good functionality and usability for the website maker and visitors.

Who is it for?

Everybody who would like to build and manage their own website embracing the archetypal index + exhibit format.

Why use it?

To become part of a community of users who place emphasis on content over complicated website design.

","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/1/997.jpg","creators_name":"Daniel Eatock, Jeffery Vaska","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.indexhibit.org/","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/1/997-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}

data_tapor: {"id":1001,"user_id":1,"name":"SpiderOak","detail":"\u003cp\u003eSpiderOak provides an private and secure online backup, sync, sharing, access \u0026amp; storage solution for all file and data types. It was designed with a 'Privacy-as-a-Platform' approach. The 'Zero-Knowledge' privacy cloud technology provides a central, private place to store data, free from surveillance by private and public entities. Data is fully encrypted end-to-end (not only during transit) and only the user is able to unlock it using their password. Passwords are never stored by SpiderOak and the company cannot see the names of files or folders in your account. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSpiderOak allows you to securely backup files (including a built-in versioning system), choose to sync data across all of your devices, and share folders or files privately using a password-protected link. Users can have unlimited devices connected to their SpiderOak account which backs up your data so you are able to restore files, even if they are deleted. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSome components of SpiderOak are open source (See GitHub Page). The company intends to be fully open source in the future but as of 2014 their source is not available. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eNew users get 2GB free (no time limit) and can upgrade to more storage as required.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1001.jpg","creators_name":"Ethan Oberman, Alan Fairless","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":null,"nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1001-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: SpiderOak provides an private and secure online backup, sync, sharing, access & storage solution for all file and data types. It was designed with a 'Privacy-as-a-Platform' approach. The 'Zero-Knowledge' privacy cloud technology provides a central, private place to store data, free from surveillance by private and public entities. Data is fully encrypted end-to-end (not only during transit) and only the user is able to unlock it using their password. Passwords are never stored by SpiderOak and the company cannot see the names of files or folders in your account. SpiderOak allows you to securely backup files (including a built-in versioning system), choose to sync data across all of your devices, and share folders or files privately using a password-protected link. Users can have unlimited devices connected to their SpiderOak account which backs up your data so you are able to restore files, even if they are deleted. Some components of SpiderOak are open source (See GitHub Page). The company intends to be fully open source in the future but as of 2014 their source is not available. New users get 2GB free (no time limit) and can upgrade to more storage as required.
name: SpiderOak

data_tapor: {"id":1002,"user_id":1,"name":"Dropbox","detail":"\u003cp\u003eDropbox is a file hosting service that includes cloud storage, personal cloud, file synchronization, and client software across multiple platforms. Dropbox allows users to create a folder on each of their computers where any type of file can be saved, synchronized, and made available across all computers. Contents of the Dropbox folder are also accessible via dropbox.com and mobile applications. Individual files and folders can be shared with other Dropbox users or made publicly accessible.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eDropbox for Business is a paid service targeting organizations by providing administrative controls and auditing functionality while allowing users to create a work account that is completely separate from their personal account but the two are viewable side by side.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1002.jpg","creators_name":"Dropbox, Inc.","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://www.dropbox.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.dropbox.com/","last_updated":"2018-11-06","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1002-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Dropbox is a file hosting service that includes cloud storage, personal cloud, file synchronization, and client software across multiple platforms. Dropbox allows users to create a folder on each of their computers where any type of file can be saved, synchronized, and made available across all computers. Contents of the Dropbox folder are also accessible via dropbox.com and mobile applications. Individual files and folders can be shared with other Dropbox users or made publicly accessible.Dropbox for Business is a paid service targeting organizations by providing administrative controls and auditing functionality while allowing users to create a work account that is completely separate from their personal account but the two are viewable side by side.
name: Dropbox

detail:
Storify is a way to tell stories using social media, including photos and videos. You can search multiple social networks from one place, drag individual elements into your timeline, and create a story. You can re-order the elements and also add text to give context to your readers. There are built in features to notify your followers of a story update.

As of May 2018, Storify is no longer available.
name: Storify

detail: Jekyll is a simple, blog aware, static site generator. It takes a template directory containing raw text files in various formats, runs it through Textile or Markdown and Liquid converters, and creates a complete, static ready-to-publish website suitable for serving with  your favorite web server. All file formats can be published, including videos and datasets that are often demoted to the supplemental materials section in current publishing models. Users of the site maintain full control over the management of their research whilst benefiting from global access, version control and secure backups in the cloud. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eBy opening up the peer review process, researchers can easily publish null results, avoiding the file drawer effect and helping to make scientific research more efficient. Figshare uses creative commons licensing to allow frictionless sharing of research data whilst allowing users to maintain their ownership.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1045.jpg","creators_name":"Digital Science","creators_email":"info@figshare.com","creators_url":"https://www.digital-science.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://figshare.com/","last_updated":"2018-10-17","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1045-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Figshare is a repository where users can make all of their research outputs available in a citable, shareable and discoverable manner.  All file formats can be published, including videos and datasets that are often demoted to the supplemental materials section in current publishing models. Users of the site maintain full control over the management of their research whilst benefiting from global access, version control and secure backups in the cloud. By opening up the peer review process, researchers can easily publish null results, avoiding the file drawer effect and helping to make scientific research more efficient. Figshare uses creative commons licensing to allow frictionless sharing of research data whilst allowing users to maintain their ownership.
name: Figshare

data_tapor: {"id":1052,"user_id":1,"name":"Pinboard","detail":"\u003cp\u003ePinboard is a social bookmarking website that describes itself as \"a fast, no-nonsense bookmarking site for people who value privacy and speed.\" The service lets users bookmark content from any web browser, offers browser plugins, and a way to save open tabs in a minimal, fast, and secure environment. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eYou can connect up to three Twitter accounts (search the archives of your tweets), and configure Pinboard to automatically mirror public bookmarks from your accounts on Instapaper, Pocket and Readability. All of your bookmarks from Delicious, Google Bookmarks, Diigo, Firefox, Safari, and many other sources can be imported to your Pinboard account. Everything on the site is available as an RSS feed and you can import and export data in a wide variety of formats. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eUnlike other popular bookmarking services, Pinboard caters to users who value privacy. You do not need to have any public bookmarks to use the site. Pinboard does not serve any third-party content to logged-in users—that means no scripts, images, analytics trackers, and no ads. You do not have to provide any personally identifying information to open a Pinboard account. The only requirement is a working email address.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThere is a third-party clients.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThere is a one time fee of $11. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIn addition to the basic features, Pinboard offers a bookmark archiving service for an annual fee of $25. The site will crawl and store a copy of every bookmark in your account, and display a special icon you can click to see a cached copy. If the page you bookmarked goes offline, you'll still be able to see the archived copy indefinitely.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePinboard is a small site that features easy access to customer support and communicating with the developer. He is easy to reach through Twitter, IRC or email,.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1052.jpg","creators_name":"Nine Fives Software, Maciej Cegłowski","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://pinboard.in/","last_updated":"2018-10-25","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1052-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Pinboard is a social bookmarking website that describes itself as "a fast, no-nonsense bookmarking site for people who value privacy and speed." The service lets users bookmark content from any web browser, offers browser plugins, and a way to save open tabs in a minimal, fast, and secure environment. You can connect up to three Twitter accounts (search the archives of your tweets), and configure Pinboard to automatically mirror public bookmarks from your accounts on Instapaper, Pocket and Readability. All of your bookmarks from Delicious, Google Bookmarks, Diigo, Firefox, Safari, and many other sources can be imported to your Pinboard account. Everything on the site is available as an RSS feed and you can import and export data in a wide variety of formats. Unlike other popular bookmarking services, Pinboard caters to users who value privacy. You do not need to have any public bookmarks to use the site. Pinboard does not serve any third-party content to logged-in users—that means no scripts, images, analytics trackers, and no ads. You do not have to provide any personally identifying information to open a Pinboard account. The only requirement is a working email address.There is a third-party clients.There is a one time fee of $11. In addition to the basic features, Pinboard offers a bookmark archiving service for an annual fee of $25. The site will crawl and store a copy of every bookmark in your account, and display a special icon you can click to see a cached copy. If the page you bookmarked goes offline, you'll still be able to see the archived copy indefinitely.Pinboard is a small site that features easy access to customer support and communicating with the developer. He is easy to reach through Twitter, IRC or email,.
name: Pinboard

data_tapor: {"id":1061,"user_id":1,"name":"Protovis","detail":"\u003cp\u003eProtovis composes custom views of data with simple marks such as bars and dots. It uses JavaScript and SVG for web-native visualizations; no plugin required (though you will need a modern web browser)! Although programming experience is helpful, Protovis is mostly declarative and designed to be learned by example.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eProtovis is no longer being developed. detail: Protovis composes custom views of data with simple marks such as bars and dots. Unlike low-level graphics libraries that quickly become tedious for visualization, Protovis defines marks through dynamic properties that encode data, allowing inheritance, scales and layouts to simplify construction.Protovis is free and open-source, provided under the BSD License. It uses JavaScript and SVG for web-native visualizations; no plugin required (though you will need a modern web browser)! Although programming experience is helpful, Protovis is mostly declarative and designed to be learned by example.Protovis is no longer being developed. data_tapor: {"id":1138,"user_id":1,"name":"Social Science Research Network","detail":"\u003cp\u003eSocial Science Research Network (SSRN) is devoted to the rapid, global dissemination of social science research. The SSRN electronic library consists of an abstract database containing abstracts on over 574,300 scholarly working papers and forthcoming papers, as well as an electronic paper collection with over 475,8000 downloadable, full-text PDF documents. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSSRN houses a number of specialized research networks in each of the social sciences, encouraging early distribution of research results, as well as direct communication between readers, authors, and other subscribers. SSRN's specialized subject area networks include:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAccounting Research Network (ARN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCognitive Science Network (CSN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCorporate Governance Network (CGN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEconomics Research Network (ERN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEntrepreneurship Research \u0026amp; Policy Network (ERPN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFinancial Economics Network (FEN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eHealth Economics Network (HEN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eInformation Systems \u0026amp; eBusiness Network (ISN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eInnovation Research \u0026amp; Policy Network (IRPN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eInternational Business \u0026amp; Management Network (INTL)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eLeadership Research Network (LRN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eLegal Scholarship Network (LSN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eManagement Research Network (MRN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMarketing Research Network (MKTG)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eNegotiations Research Network (NEG)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOrganizational Behavior Research Network (ORG)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePolitical Science Network (PSN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSocial Insurance Research Network (SIRN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSustainability Research \u0026amp; Policy Network (SRPN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eClassics Research Network (CRN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMusic Research \u0026amp; Composition Network (MRCN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePhilosophy Research Network (PRN)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eRhetoric \u0026amp; Communication Research Network (RCRN)\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1138.jpg","creators_name":"Social Science Electronic Publishing Inc.","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.ssrn.com/en/","last_updated":"2018-11-06","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1138-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Social Science Research Network (SSRN) is devoted to the rapid, global dissemination of social science research. The SSRN electronic library consists of an abstract database containing abstracts on over 574,300 scholarly working papers and forthcoming papers, as well as an electronic paper collection with over 475,8000 downloadable, full-text PDF documents. SSRN houses a number of specialized research networks in each of the social sciences, encouraging early distribution of research results, as well as direct communication between readers, authors, and other subscribers. SSRN's specialized subject area networks include:Accounting Research Network (ARN)Cognitive Science Network (CSN)Corporate Governance Network (CGN)Economics Research Network (ERN)Entrepreneurship Research & Policy Network (ERPN)Financial Economics Network (FEN)Health Economics Network (HEN)Information Systems & eBusiness Network (ISN)Innovation Research & Policy Network (IRPN)International Business & Management Network (INTL)Leadership Research Network (LRN)Legal Scholarship Network (LSN)Management Research Network (MRN)Marketing Research Network (MKTG)Negotiations Research Network (NEG)Organizational Behavior Research Network (ORG)Political Science Network (PSN)Social Insurance Research Network (SIRN)Sustainability Research & Policy Network (SRPN)Classics Research Network (CRN)Music Research & Composition Network (MRCN)Philosophy Research Network (PRN)Rhetoric & Communication Research Network (RCRN)
name: SSRN Electronic Journal

data_tapor: {"id":1170,"user_id":1,"name":"TitanPad","detail":"\u003cp\u003eTitanPad is a free web 2.0 tool that enables users to work collaboratively in a single document. Similar to Google Documents, this online tool allows many people to work simultaneously on the document. Users can chat while working on the document, can import existing documents to work on and also export documents from TitanPad. It also provides the option to view previous versions of the document and includes a time slider to view the entire history of the document.\u003cbr\u003e TitanPad was effectively shutdown on the 31st of December 2017 because of unsustainability.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1170.jpg","creators_name":"Christian Hofstädtler","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"http://blog.titanpad.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":"2022-03-27","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1170-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: TitanPad is a free web 2.0 tool that enables users to work collaboratively in a single document. Similar to Google Documents, this online tool allows many people to work simultaneously on the document. Users can chat while working on the document, can import existing documents to work on and also export documents from TitanPad. It also provides the option to view previous versions of the document and includes a time slider to view the entire history of the document. TitanPad was effectively shutdown on the 31st of December 2017 because of unsustainability.
name: Titanpad

data_tapor: {"id":1171,"user_id":1,"name":"TiddlyWiki","detail":"\u003cp\u003eTiddlyWiki is a reusable personal web notebook. It allows anyone to create personal hypertext documents that can be published on the Web, and also search and tag content. The developers write, \"TiddlyWiki is designed to be non-linear, structuring content with stories, tags, hyperlinks, and other features. You can organise and retrieve your notes in ways that conform to your personal thought patterns, rather than feel chained to one preset organisational structure. You can use TiddlyWiki as a single file that you view and edit through any web browser, whether you are online or offline. Or you can use it as a powerful Node.js application that stores each of your notes as a separate file.\"\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/missing.jpg","creators_name":"UnaMesa","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":null,"nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/missing-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: TiddlyWiki is a reusable personal web notebook. It allows anyone to create personal hypertext documents that can be published on the Web, and also search and tag content. The developers write, "TiddlyWiki is designed to be non-linear, structuring content with stories, tags, hyperlinks, and other features. You can organise and retrieve your notes in ways that conform to your personal thought patterns, rather than feel chained to one preset organisational structure. You can use TiddlyWiki as a single file that you view and edit through any web browser, whether you are online or offline. Or you can use it as a powerful Node.js application that stores each of your notes as a separate file."
name: TiddlyWiki

data_tapor: {"id":1174,"user_id":1,"name":"VoiceThread","detail":"\u003cp\u003eVoiceThread is a collaborative cloud based service into which users upload over 55 types of documents and other users can comment in five different ways (using voice, text, audio, or video). VoiceThreads can be embedded to show and receive comments on other websites, and exported to play as archival movies. It can be used for asynchronous learning with students commenting and adding discussions to a started VoiceThread.\u003c/p\u003e The original creators in 2005 were Ben Papell and Steve Muth.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1174.jpg","creators_name":"VoiceThread LLC","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://voicethread.com/","last_updated":"2022-03-27","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1174-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: VoiceThread is a collaborative cloud based service into which users upload over 55 types of documents and other users can comment in five different ways (using voice, text, audio, or video). VoiceThreads can be embedded to show and receive comments on other websites, and exported to play as archival movies. It can be used for asynchronous learning with students commenting and adding discussions to a started VoiceThread. The original creators in 2005 were Ben Papell and Steve Muth.
name: VoiceThread

data_tapor: {"id":1190,"user_id":1,"name":"Bookends","detail":"\u003cp\u003eReference management entails the collection, annotation, curation, and citation of published information. Bookends simplifies these tasks. Bookends can perform Internet searches to retrieve references and associated pdfs or web pages, or immediately find and import references for which you already have the pdf. Versatile groups (static, smart, and virtual), term lists (keywords, authors, etc.), reference cross-linking (links), multiple notecards per reference, PDF annotation, tag clouds, and instantaneous live searches help organize and find information in your personal collection. Highly configurable displays let you view the reference information and attachments the way you want. Scan your word processor manuscripts to create publication-ready documents complete with bibliographies and footnotes. Sync references and pdfs in your library with your iPhone, iPod Touch, or iPad (requires separate purchase of Bookends On Tap from the iTunes App Store). Create and edit PDF annotations and highlighted text, which instantly appear as Bookends notecards. And much more. Compatible with Microsoft Word, Mellel (including Live Bibliography, updating of citations and bibliographies as you type), Apple Pages '08, ’09, and (provisionally) Pages 5, Nisus Writer Pro, and OpenOffice 3.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1190.jpg","creators_name":"Sonny Software","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://www.sonnysoftware.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.sonnysoftware.com/","last_updated":"2018-10-26","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1190-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Reference management entails the collection, annotation, curation, and citation of published information. Bookends simplifies these tasks. Bookends can perform Internet searches to retrieve references and associated pdfs or web pages, or immediately find and import references for which you already have the pdf. Versatile groups (static, smart, and virtual), term lists (keywords, authors, etc.), reference cross-linking (links), multiple notecards per reference, PDF annotation, tag clouds, and instantaneous live searches help organize and find information in your personal collection. Highly configurable displays let you view the reference information and attachments the way you want. Scan your word processor manuscripts to create publication-ready documents complete with bibliographies and footnotes. Sync references and pdfs in your library with your iPhone, iPod Touch, or iPad (requires separate purchase of Bookends On Tap from the iTunes App Store). Create and edit PDF annotations and highlighted text, which instantly appear as Bookends notecards. And much more. Compatible with Microsoft Word, Mellel (including Live Bibliography, updating of citations and bibliographies as you type), Apple Pages '08, ’09, and (provisionally) Pages 5, Nisus Writer Pro, and OpenOffice 3.
name: Bookends

{"id":1207,"user_id":1,"name":"Pattern","detail":"

Pattern is a web mining module for Python. It has tools for:

  • Data Mining: web services (Google, Twitter, Wikipedia), web crawler, HTML DOM parser
  • Natural Language Processing: part-of-speech taggers, n-gram search, sentiment analysis, WordNet
  • Machine Learning: vector space model, clustering, classification (KNN, SVM, Perceptron)
  • Network Analysis: graph centrality and visualization.
It is well documented, thoroughly tested with 350+ unit tests and comes bundled with 50+ examples. The source code is licensed under BSD.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1207.jpg","creators_name":"Tom De Smedt","creators_email":"tom@organisms.be","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://pypi.org/project/Pattern/","last_updated":"2022-02-03","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/clips/pattern","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1207-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Pattern is a web mining module for Python. It has tools for:

Data Mining: web services (Google, Twitter, Wikipedia), web crawler, HTML DOM parser
Natural Language Processing: part-of-speech taggers, n-gram search, sentiment analysis, WordNet
Machine Learning: vector space model, clustering, classification (KNN, SVM, Perceptron)
Network Analysis: graph centrality and visualization.

It is well documented, thoroughly tested with 350+ unit tests and comes bundled with 50+ examples. The source code is licensed under BSD.
name: Pattern

data_tapor: {"id":1210,"user_id":1,"name":"MySQL","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA software application that enables relational databases to be created, managed and queried. The database management system enables multiple users to access a database through an appropriate interface. As an open source tool, MySQL underpins a number of free software projects, such as WordPress, phpBB and other software built on a LAMP infrastructure. Although widely used, there are a number of performance issues that limit its use in some environments. For example, it is unable to use multiple CPU cores to process a single query, potentially limiting its use as a data warehouse.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eX/Open XA distributed transaction processing (DTP) support\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eConnector/ODBC enables connection to a MySQL server using the Open Database Connectivity (ODBC) API\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eConnector/NET enables developers to create .NET applications that use data stored in a MySQL database\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1210.jpg","creators_name":"Sun Microsystems","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.mysql.com/","last_updated":"2021-12-09","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1210-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A software application that enables relational databases to be created, managed and queried. The database management system enables multiple users to access a database through an appropriate interface. As an open source tool, MySQL underpins a number of free software projects, such as WordPress, phpBB and other software built on a LAMP infrastructure. Although widely used, there are a number of performance issues that limit its use in some environments. For example, it is unable to use multiple CPU cores to process a single query, potentially limiting its use as a data warehouse.Features: X/Open XA distributed transaction processing (DTP) supportConnector/ODBC enables connection to a MySQL server using the Open Database Connectivity (ODBC) APIConnector/NET enables developers to create .NET applications that use data stored in a MySQL database
name: MySQL

data_tapor: {"id":1211,"user_id":1,"name":"SQL Server","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA server-side software application that enables databases conformant to a relational data model to be created, managed and queried. Information, most commonly text may be stored as one or more records contained within a table. The table may exist in isolation or have some relationship to other tables. Information may be manipulated using a set of T-SQL or ANSI SQL commands. Several editions of SQL Server 2014 are available, including SQL Server Business Intelligence, Developer, Enterprise, Express, Standard and Web. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eService Broker\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eReplication Services using transaction, merge, or snapshot replication\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAnalysis functionality to perform data mining, OLAP and other services\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eReport generation services\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEnterprise scalability across compute, networking, and storage\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eConsistent data platform on-premises to cloud\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEasy integration with Microsoft Azure\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1211.jpg","creators_name":"Microsoft","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://www.microsoft.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.microsoft.com/en-ca/sql-server/sql-server-2017","last_updated":"2018-10-26","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1211-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A server-side software application that enables databases conformant to a relational data model to be created, managed and queried. Information, most commonly text may be stored as one or more records contained within a table. The table may exist in isolation or have some relationship to other tables. Information may be manipulated using a set of T-SQL or ANSI SQL commands. Several editions of SQL Server 2014 are available, including SQL Server Business Intelligence, Developer, Enterprise, Express, Standard and Web. Features: Service BrokerReplication Services using transaction, merge, or snapshot replicationAnalysis functionality to perform data mining, OLAP and other servicesReport generation servicesEnterprise scalability across compute, networking, and storageConsistent data platform on-premises to cloudEasy integration with Microsoft Azure
name: Microsoft SQL Server

data_tapor: {"id":1213,"user_id":1,"name":"OmniPage","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA software tool capable of performing Optical Character Recognition (OCR) upon a set of images. It was one of the first OCR recognition software to be developed. It was developed in the late 1980s and sold by Caere Corporation. It is currently owned by  Kofax Inc. It achieves the task by analysing pixel sets and in an image and cross-matching them to a dictionary of words. Omnipage automates large sections of the digitisation process enabling physical objects to be scanned, processed using the OCR software and exported to a document file format. Later versions of the software incorporate image enhancement features to improve scan quality (and recognition results) and better support for complex page layouts and forms.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIntegration with scanning software\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMaintain layout of captured document\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1213.jpg","creators_name":"Kofax Inc.","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.kofax.com/products/omnipage","last_updated":"2021-12-09","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1213-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A software tool capable of performing Optical Character Recognition (OCR) upon a set of images. It was one of the first OCR recognition software to be developed. It was developed in the late 1980s and sold by Caere Corporation. It is currently owned by  Kofax Inc. It achieves the task by analysing pixel sets and in an image and cross-matching them to a dictionary of words. Omnipage automates large sections of the digitisation process enabling physical objects to be scanned, processed using the OCR software and exported to a document file format. Later versions of the software incorporate image enhancement features to improve scan quality (and recognition results) and better support for complex page layouts and forms.Features: Integration with scanning softwareMaintain layout of captured document
name: OmniPage

data_tapor: {"id":1217,"user_id":1,"name":"Adobe After Effects","detail":"\u003cp\u003eAfter Effects is a digital motion graphics and compositing software. data_tapor: {"id":1220,"user_id":1,"name":"SoundScriber","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA software application for the playback of audio recordings. SoundScriber offers specific functionality for researchers that wish to transcribe a recording. It was originally developed for use in the Michigan Corpus of Academic Spoken English (MICASE) project and released for use by academics performing similar work.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAudio playback via installed audio codecs (e.g. Wav, MP3)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eVariable speed playback\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e'Walking' support – playback of a small stretch of an audio stream several times to ensure accurate transcription is made, followed by an advancement to a new section of audio.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1220.jpg","creators_name":"University of Michigan","creators_email":"ebreck@umich.edu","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www-personal.umich.edu/~ebreck/code/sscriber/","last_updated":"2021-12-03","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"http://www-personal.umich.edu/~ebreck/data/sscriber/sscriber-source.tgz","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1220-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A software application for the playback of audio recordings. SoundScriber offers specific functionality for researchers that wish to transcribe a recording. It was originally developed for use in the Michigan Corpus of Academic Spoken English (MICASE) project and released for use by academics performing similar work.Features: Audio playback via installed audio codecs (e.g. Wav, MP3)Variable speed playback'Walking' support – playback of a small stretch of an audio stream several times to ensure accurate transcription is made, followed by an advancement to a new section of audio.
name: SoundScriber

data_tapor: {"id":1221,"user_id":1,"name":"Fedora Commons","detail":"\u003cp\u003eFedora (Flexible Extensible Digital Object Repository Architecture) was originally developed by researchers at Cornell University as an architecture to store, manage, and access digital content in the form of digital objects. Fedora defines a set of abstractions for expressing digital objects, asserting relationships among digital objects, and linking behaviors to digital objects. Developed by the community and stewarded by Duraspace —  a nonprofit involved with open source technology projects including VIVO and DSpace — Fedora Commons implements the Fedora abstractions in an open source, modular repository system for managing and disseminating digital content. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFedora Commons is widely used in the academic sector as a basis for digital libraries, archives, or repository systems. Its worldwide installed user base includes academic and cultural heritage organizations, universities, research institutions, university libraries, national libraries, government agencies, and more.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eManagement and maintenance of any digital content type and of metadata about content in any format\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eScale to millions of objects\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAccess data via APIs (REST/SOAP)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eProvide RDF search (SPARQL)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eRebuilder utility (for disaster recovery and data migration)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEntire repository can be rebuilt from the digital object and content files\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eContent model architecture (define \"types\" of objects by their content)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMany storage options (database and file systems)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eJMS messaging (your apps can \"listen\" to repository events)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWeb-based administrator GUI (low-level object editing)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOAI-PMH provider service\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGSearch (fulltext) search service\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMultiple, customer driven front-ends\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1221.jpg","creators_name":"Duraspace","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://duraspace.org/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://duraspace.org/fedora/","last_updated":"2018-10-12","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/FF","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1221-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Fedora (Flexible Extensible Digital Object Repository Architecture) was originally developed by researchers at Cornell University as an architecture to store, manage, and access digital content in the form of digital objects. Fedora defines a set of abstractions for expressing digital objects, asserting relationships among digital objects, and linking behaviors to digital objects. Developed by the community and stewarded by Duraspace —  a nonprofit involved with open source technology projects including VIVO and DSpace — Fedora Commons implements the Fedora abstractions in an open source, modular repository system for managing and disseminating digital content. Fedora Commons is widely used in the academic sector as a basis for digital libraries, archives, or repository systems. Its worldwide installed user base includes academic and cultural heritage organizations, universities, research institutions, university libraries, national libraries, government agencies, and more.Management and maintenance of any digital content type and of metadata about content in any formatScale to millions of objectsAccess data via APIs (REST/SOAP)Provide RDF search (SPARQL)Rebuilder utility (for disaster recovery and data migration)Entire repository can be rebuilt from the digital object and content filesContent model architecture (define "types" of objects by their content)Many storage options (database and file systems)JMS messaging (your apps can "listen" to repository events)Web-based administrator GUI (low-level object editing)OAI-PMH provider serviceGSearch (fulltext) search serviceMultiple, customer driven front-ends
name: Fedora Commons

data_tapor: {"id":1223,"user_id":1,"name":"Xalan","detail":"\u003cp\u003eXalan is an XSLT processor for transforming XML documents into HTML, text, or other XML document types. It implements XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 1.0 and XML Path Language (XPath) Version 1.0.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eConversion between structured markup formats\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eStylesheet validation\u003c/p\u003e It is available for Java and C++.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1223.jpg","creators_name":"Apache Software Foundation","creators_email":"xalan-j-users@xml.apache.org","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://xml.apache.org/xalan-j/","last_updated":"2021-12-03","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1223-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Xalan is an XSLT processor for transforming XML documents into HTML, text, or other XML document types. It implements XSL Transformations (XSLT) Version 1.0 and XML Path Language (XPath) Version 1.0.Features: Conversion between structured markup formatsStylesheet validation It is available for Java and C++.
name: Apache Xalan

data_tapor: {"id":1234,"user_id":1,"name":"Zoomify","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA suite of products developed for web designers that may be used to convert large images into a form that can be zoomed and panned. Zoomify enables large images to be viewed and manipulated, without an increase in server load or download time. It converts large images stored in raster formats (e.g. TIFF, JPEG) into a set of pieces or 'tiles' The individual pieces contain sub-sections of the image at different resolutions or levels of zoom, which are combined to create a type of mosaic.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEnables access to high quality still images without an increase in server load\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1234.jpg","creators_name":"Zoomify Inc.","creators_email":"support@zoomify.com","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www.zoomify.com/","last_updated":"2021-09-09","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1234-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A suite of products developed for web designers that may be used to convert large images into a form that can be zoomed and panned. Zoomify enables large images to be viewed and manipulated, without an increase in server load or download time. It converts large images stored in raster formats (e.g. TIFF, JPEG) into a set of pieces or 'tiles' The individual pieces contain sub-sections of the image at different resolutions or levels of zoom, which are combined to create a type of mosaic.Features: Enables access to high quality still images without an increase in server load
name: Zoomify

data_tapor: {"id":1249,"user_id":1,"name":"Apache Subversion Version System (SVN)","detail":"\u003cp\u003eApache Subversion Version System (SVN) is an open source version control system. Access and revision to objects are carefully controlled, to prevent unauthorized access and alteration. Developers use SVN to maintain current and historical versions of files such as source code, web pages, and documentation. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eTheir Vision: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSubversion exists to be universally recognized and adopted as an open-source, centralized version control system characterized by its reliability as a safe haven for valuable data; the simplicity of its model and usage; and its ability to support the needs of a wide variety of users and projects, from individuals to large-scale enterprise operations.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eVersion support for all files and directories in repository, enabling administrator to track changes that have occurred and obtain earlier versions of files\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eRenamed/copied/moved/removed files retain full revision history\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFree-form versioned metadata\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAtomic commits\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMerge tracking\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFile locking\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eChangelists to organize commits into commit groups\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePreservation of file attributes, such as executable and read/write status\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eApache network server support with WebDAV/DeltaV protocol\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWrite-through proxy using WebDAV\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eInteractive conflict resolution\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e Repository read-only mirroring\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eParsable output, including XML log output\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e Full MIME support - users can view or change the MIME type of each file, with the software knowing which MIME types can have their differences from previous versions shown\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1249.jpg","creators_name":"Apache Software Foundation","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://www.apache.org/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://subversion.apache.org/","last_updated":"2018-10-19","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://subversion.apache.org/download.cgi?update=201708081800","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1249-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Apache Subversion Version System (SVN) is an open source version control system. Access and revision to objects are carefully controlled, to prevent unauthorized access and alteration. Developers use SVN to maintain current and historical versions of files such as source code, web pages, and documentation. Their Vision: Subversion exists to be universally recognized and adopted as an open-source, centralized version control system characterized by its reliability as a safe haven for valuable data; the simplicity of its model and usage; and its ability to support the needs of a wide variety of users and projects, from individuals to large-scale enterprise operations.Features:Version support for all files and directories in repository, enabling administrator to track changes that have occurred and obtain earlier versions of filesRenamed/copied/moved/removed files retain full revision historyFree-form versioned metadataAtomic commitsMerge trackingFile lockingChangelists to organize commits into commit groupsPreservation of file attributes, such as executable and read/write statusApache network server support with WebDAV/DeltaV protocolWrite-through proxy using WebDAVInteractive conflict resolution Repository read-only mirroringParsable output, including XML log output Full MIME support - users can view or change the MIME type of each file, with the software knowing which MIME types can have their differences from previous versions shown
name: Apache Subversion

data_tapor: {"id":1250,"user_id":1,"name":"Adobe Dreamweaver","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA visual development tool for creating, publishing, and managing websites and mobile content: Dreamweaver offers a graphics-based WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You GET pronounced wizzywig) and code-based user interface for the development of web pages and sites. The tool may be used to simplify the process of web site development (in comparison to creation of individual web pages), through the provision of a templating system that allows single-source update of shared code and layout across entire sites without server-side includes or scripting.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWYSIWYG\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCode hinting for Ajax and JavaScript frameworks\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSubversion integration\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFTP/SFTP support\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWebDav support\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWeb site template system\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAdobe Spry AJAX framework support\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1250.jpg","creators_name":"Adobe Systems Incorporated","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://www.adobe.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.adobe.com/ca/products/dreamweaver.html","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1250-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A visual development tool for creating, publishing, and managing websites and mobile content: Dreamweaver offers a graphics-based WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You GET pronounced wizzywig) and code-based user interface for the development of web pages and sites. The tool may be used to simplify the process of web site development (in comparison to creation of individual web pages), through the provision of a templating system that allows single-source update of shared code and layout across entire sites without server-side includes or scripting.Features: WYSIWYG  Code hinting for Ajax and JavaScript frameworks  Subversion integration  FTP/SFTP support  WebDav support  Web site template system  Adobe Spry AJAX framework support
name: Adobe Dreamweaver

{"id":1252,"user_id":1,"name":"Perl","detail":"Perl is a high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language. Originally developed for text manipulation, it is now used for a wide range of tasks including graphics programming, system administration, network programming, applications that require database access and CGI programming on the Web.

Features:

- C, shell scripting (sh), AWK, and sed

- Powerful text processing facilities

- Flexibility and adaptability

-Support for multiple programming paradigms

-Reference counting memory management

","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1252.jpg","creators_name":"The Perl Foundation","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.perl.org/","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/Perl/perl5","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1252-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Perl is a high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language. Originally developed for text manipulation, it is now used for a wide range of tasks including graphics programming, system administration, network programming, applications that require database access and CGI programming on the Web.

Features:

- C, shell scripting (sh), AWK, and sed

- Powerful text processing facilities

- Flexibility and adaptability

-Support for multiple programming paradigms

-Reference counting memory management
name: Perl

data_tapor: {"id":1254,"user_id":1,"name":"ArcGIS","detail":"\u003cp\u003eArcGIS is a suite of software that comprises of Desktop GIS, Server GIS, Mobile GIS, and ArcGIS Online. ArcGIS is a platform for building a complete geographic information system (GIS) that lets you easily create, edit, and analyse geographic knowledge on the desktop; publish data, maps, globes and models to a GIS server and/or share them online; and use them on the desktop, on the Web, or in the field.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eView and query maps\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eManipulate shapefiles and geodatabases\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eData manipulation, editing and analysis\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eMobile device enabled\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1254.jpg","creators_name":"Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI)","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.esri.com/zh-cn/arcgis/products/arcgis-online/overview","last_updated":"2018-09-27","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1254-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: ArcGIS is a suite of software that comprises of Desktop GIS, Server GIS, Mobile GIS, and ArcGIS Online. ArcGIS is a platform for building a complete geographic information system (GIS) that lets you easily create, edit, and analyse geographic knowledge on the desktop; publish data, maps, globes and models to a GIS server and/or share them online; and use them on the desktop, on the Web, or in the field.Features: View and query mapsManipulate shapefiles and geodatabasesData manipulation, editing and analysisMobile device enabled
name: ArcGIS

data_tapor: {"id":1255,"user_id":1,"name":"Autodesk 3ds Max","detail":"\u003cp\u003eAutodesk 3ds Max (formerly 3D Studio MAX) is an open source graphics software tool used by video game developers, motion picture studios and architectural visualisers for modelling and animation projects. One of the most advanced 3D modelling tools in the industry, 3ds Max has been utilised by many CGI-animated films such as Avatar and 2012 to generate computer graphics alongside live acting.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCreate parametric and organic objects with polygonal and freeform tools\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  Character Studio enables life-like virtual character animation\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  Scene Explorer provides hierarchical views of complex scene data and analysis\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  Wide range of creative textures, planar mapping and layering options\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  MAXScript built-in scripting language automates repetitive tasks and assists with new tool and interface development\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  Multiple user collaborations\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e  Customisable and intutive user interface\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1255.jpg","creators_name":"Autodesk, Inc.","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.autodesk.ca/en/products/3ds-max/overview","last_updated":"2021-08-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1255-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Autodesk 3ds Max (formerly 3D Studio MAX) is an open source graphics software tool used by video game developers, motion picture studios and architectural visualisers for modelling and animation projects. One of the most advanced 3D modelling tools in the industry, 3ds Max has been utilised by many CGI-animated films such as Avatar and 2012 to generate computer graphics alongside live acting.Features: Create parametric and organic objects with polygonal and freeform tools  Character Studio enables life-like virtual character animation  Scene Explorer provides hierarchical views of complex scene data and analysis  Wide range of creative textures, planar mapping and layering options  MAXScript built-in scripting language automates repetitive tasks and assists with new tool and interface development  Multiple user collaborations  Customisable and intutive user interface

detail: LibX is a Firefox or Chrome plugin that enables direct access to the user's library's resources, including support for Google Scholar, CiteULike, COinS, and xISBN. Users can search their library catalog(s) and databases through a search bar or through a context menu. Presently it is no longer supported on Chrome (and maybe also Firefox) but it is supported by Internet Explorer. The latest release was in 2013 so it might not be compatible with recent releases of Internet Explorer.
name: LibX

data_tapor: {"id":1262,"user_id":1,"name":"Google Books","detail":"\u003cp\u003eGoogle Books provides full, free PDF scans (and web-viewable versions) of public domain books and magazines, free previews of some books and magazines under copyright, and the option to purchase digital editions of available items to save and read on Google Play, their e-reading platform. You can also find a local library based on your zip code that has the item available. Reader reviews of the items are available and you can contribute your own. Search for authors, titles, as well as keywords and Google will return results with matches in the title/text of the item. There are permalinks to available pages. Highly useful for finding items that contain your keywords in its text.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIt has the \u003ca href=\"http://tapor.ca/tools/314\"\u003eGoogle Ngram Viewer\u003c/a\u003e as part of its service. The Ngram Viewer is a service connected to Google Books that graphs the frequency of word usage across their book collection\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1262.jpg","creators_name":"Google Inc","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://books.google.com/","last_updated":"2021-06-23","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1262-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Google Books provides full, free PDF scans (and web-viewable versions) of public domain books and magazines, free previews of some books and magazines under copyright, and the option to purchase digital editions of available items to save and read on Google Play, their e-reading platform. You can also find a local library based on your zip code that has the item available. Reader reviews of the items are available and you can contribute your own. Search for authors, titles, as well as keywords and Google will return results with matches in the title/text of the item. There are permalinks to available pages. Highly useful for finding items that contain your keywords in its text.It has the Google Ngram Viewer as part of its service. The Ngram Viewer is a service connected to Google Books that graphs the frequency of word usage across their book collection
name: Google Books

detail: The DOAJ (Directory of Open Access Journals) is a full-text search engine for open access journals.

detail: BASE (Bielefeld Academic Search Engine) is a search engine for academic open access web resources that searches materials stored in OAI-PMH (Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting) enabled repositories.
name: BASE (Bielefeld Academic Search Engine)
