data_tapor: {"id":1271,"user_id":1,"name":"Ushahidi Platform","detail":"\u003cp\u003eUshahidi is a software for information collection, visualization and interactive mapping, to build tools for democratizing information, increasing transparency and lowering the barriers for individuals to share their stories. It has been used for election monitoring, crisis and emergency response, civil society, city/community building, arts and even where to find the best burger. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSpecific tools: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCrowdmap: A simple map-making tool, built on an open API, that allows for collaborative mapping\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSwiftriver: Curate real-time data and analysis from a variety of sources, including social media streams\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCrisisNET: A consolidated source of global crisis data\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePing: Two-way multichannel group alert during an emergency\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSMSSync: Create a two way gateway with an Android phone and local SIM anywhere in the world\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eBRCK: Supports connectivity in remote locations, self-powered, mobile WiFi device\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1271.jpg","creators_name":"Ushahidi","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.ushahidi.com/","last_updated":"2018-11-06","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1271-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Ushahidi is a software for information collection, visualization and interactive mapping, to build tools for democratizing information, increasing transparency and lowering the barriers for individuals to share their stories. It has been used for election monitoring, crisis and emergency response, civil society, city/community building, arts and even where to find the best burger. Specific tools: Crowdmap: A simple map-making tool, built on an open API, that allows for collaborative mappingSwiftriver: Curate real-time data and analysis from a variety of sources, including social media streamsCrisisNET: A consolidated source of global crisis dataPing: Two-way multichannel group alert during an emergencySMSSync: Create a two way gateway with an Android phone and local SIM anywhere in the worldBRCK: Supports connectivity in remote locations, self-powered, mobile WiFi device
name: Ushahidi

data_tapor: {"id":1275,"user_id":1,"name":"PDFsam (PDF Split and Merge)","detail":"\u003cp\u003ePDFsam Basic or PDF Split and Merge is a free and open-source cross-platform desktop application to split, merge, extract pages, rotate and mix PDF documents. detail: PDFsam Basic or PDF Split and Merge is a free and open-source cross-platform desktop application to split, merge, extract pages, rotate and mix PDF documents. PDFsam Basic is a desktop application freely accessible from the project's page both as source and compiled code. It is available as MSI package for 32-bit and 64-bit MS Windows, .dmg for Mac OS X, .deb package for Debian based GNU/Linux distributions and ZIP bundle for the power users' convenience.
name: PDF Split and Merge

detail: PDFCreator is an application for converting documents into Portable Document Format (PDF) format on Microsoft Windows operating systems. data_tapor:
{"id":1290,"user_id":1,"name":"Praat","detail":"

Praat is free software for the phonetic analysis of speech, including support for articulatory and speech synthesis.

The most current release is version 6.2.05 . It is now available on a variety of operating systems including Window, Macintosh, Raspberry Pi, Chromebook, Linux.
Praat now includes many additional functionalities among which are:
- Statistical analysis
- Listening experiments
- Speech manipulations
- Learning algorithms.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1290.jpg","creators_name":"Paul Boersma, David Weenink","creators_email":"paul.boersma@uva.nl","creators_url":"http://www.fon.hum.uva.nl/paul/","star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www.fon.hum.uva.nl/praat/","last_updated":"2022-01-12","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1290-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Praat is free software for the phonetic analysis of speech, including support for articulatory and speech synthesis.
The most current release is version 6.2.05 . It is now available on a variety of operating systems including Window, Macintosh, Raspberry Pi, Chromebook, Linux.  Praat now includes many additional functionalities among which are: 
- Statistical analysis
- Listening experiments
- Speech manipulations 
- Learning algorithms.
name: Praat

data_tapor: {"id":1291,"user_id":1,"name":"Natural Language Toolkit","detail":"\u003cp\u003eThe Natural Language Toolkit (NLTK) is an open source Python library for text analysis and natural language processing. NLTK can tokenize strings (create a list of words from a set of characters), identify parts of speech, and perform operations based on a word's context.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":false,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1291.jpg","creators_name":"","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":"2019-09-26","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1291-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: The Natural Language Toolkit (NLTK) is an open source Python library for text analysis and natural language processing. NLTK can tokenize strings (create a list of words from a set of characters), identify parts of speech, and perform operations based on a word's context.
name: Natural Language Toolkit

data_tapor: {"id":1292,"user_id":1,"name":"Annotation Graph Toolkit (AGTK)","detail":"\u003cp\u003eAGTK is a suite of software components for building tools for annotating linguistic signals, time-series data which documents any kind of linguistic behavior (e.g. audio, video). The internal data structures are based on annotation graphs. Annotation Graphs are a formal framework for representing linguistic annotations of time series data. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e(Note: last release 2007. Last update on sourceforge page 2011). The links on the sourceforge page are broken: software is reportedly released under a 'Common Public Licence', although the link to the licence at http://www.opensource.org/ is broken; link to the project website at the Linguistic Data Consortium is broken.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1292.jpg","creators_name":"Steven Bird (coordinator), Xiaoyi Ma (AG library), Haejoong Lee (AG library), Kazuaki Maeda (applications), Beth Randall (applications), Salim Zayat (applications), John Breen (applications), Craig Martell (applications), Chris Osborn (applications), Jonathan Dick (Java port)","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://agtk.sourceforge.net/","last_updated":"2018-10-05","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1292-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: AGTK is a suite of software components for building tools for annotating linguistic signals, time-series data which documents any kind of linguistic behavior (e.g. audio, video). The internal data structures are based on annotation graphs. Annotation Graphs are a formal framework for representing linguistic annotations of time series data. (Note: last release 2007. Last update on sourceforge page 2011). The links on the sourceforge page are broken: software is reportedly released under a 'Common Public Licence', although the link to the licence at http://www.opensource.org/ is broken; link to the project website at the Linguistic Data Consortium is broken.
name: Annotation Graph Toolkit

data_tapor: {"id":1302,"user_id":1,"name":"Freebase","detail":"\u003cp\u003eFreebase was \"an open, Creative Commons Attribution (aka CC-BY) licensed collection of structured data,\" and a \"platform for accessing and manipulating that data\" via API. Almost 40 million entities and assertions about those entities are stored within a graph database. The database was built by pulling in open data and relies on community contribution to stay updated. Freebase was part of the semantic web and emits Linked Open Data (via RDF) for all its entities.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1302.jpg","creators_name":"Google","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://developers.google.com/freebase/","last_updated":"2018-10-05","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1302-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Freebase was "an open, Creative Commons Attribution (aka CC-BY) licensed collection of structured data," and a "platform for accessing and manipulating that data" via API. Almost 40 million entities and assertions about those entities are stored within a graph database. The database was built by pulling in open data and relies on community contribution to stay updated. Freebase was part of the semantic web and emits Linked Open Data (via RDF) for all its entities.
name: Freebase

detail: Google Docs is an online environment for editing and sharing documents, spreadsheets, presentations, forms, drawings, and tables. Google Docs documents can be public or private, or shared with anyone with a Google account, e-mailed, or downloaded in various formats, including conversions to PDF and other formats not identical to the original or to the proprietary format used at creation. data_tapor: {"id":1375,"user_id":1,"name":"oXygen XML editor","detail":"\u003cp\u003eA cross-platform XML editor that may be used to create and validate XML documents and associated schema. It fully supports XSL (both XSLT and FO), DTD, Schema (Relax RNG and W3C), Database, XQuery and CSS. OXygen XML Editor works with all XML-based technologies, including XML databases, XProc pipelines, and web services and comes with ready-to-use DITA, DocBook, TEI, and XHTML support.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFrequently updated and supported, and with a very large set of features, this software tool has proved popular with digital humanists.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1375.jpg","creators_name":"SyncRO Soft Ltd","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.componentsource.com/license/oxygen-xml-editor-enterprise?cc=ca\u0026utm_source=google\u0026utm_medium=cpc\u0026utm_campaign=ga10_ca_en\u0026gclid=EAIaIQobChMIttm0l_ei3gIVlMVkCh3nzw-pEAAYASAAEgLaDvD_BwE","last_updated":"2018-10-26","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1375-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: A cross-platform XML editor that may be used to create and validate XML documents and associated schema. It fully supports XSL (both XSLT and FO), DTD, Schema (Relax RNG and W3C), Database, XQuery and CSS. OXygen XML Editor works with all XML-based technologies, including XML databases, XProc pipelines, and web services and comes with ready-to-use DITA, DocBook, TEI, and XHTML support.Frequently updated and supported, and with a very large set of features, this software tool has proved popular with digital humanists.
name: Oxygen XML Editor

detail: Solr is an open source enterprise search platform from the Apache Lucene project. It operates as a standalone full-text search server within an appropriate servlet container, such as Tomcat. Solr uses the Lucene Java search library at its core for full-text indexing and search, and has REST-like HTTP/XML and JSON APIs that make it easy to use from virtually any programming language.
name: Apache Solr

data_tapor: {"id":1394,"user_id":1,"name":"ERDAS Imagine","detail":"\u003cp\u003eERDAS Imagine is a suite of geospatial data authoring software. The suite contains a raster graphics editor and remote sensing application that performs advanced remote sensing analysis and spatial modelling to create new information. ERDAS IMAGINE can also visualize results in 2D, 3D, video, and on cartographic quality map compositions. It is primarily designed for geospatial raster data processing and the creation of digital images for mapping use in GIS or CAD software. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e Image Analysis, Remote Sensing \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eParallel Batch Processing\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e Spatial Modeling\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eHigh Performance Mosaicking Engine in IMAGINE Advantage\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e Expanded Change Detection Tools (with Zonal Change Detection)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e ERDAS ER Mapper Algorithms\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e Converts over 190 Image Formats to all Major File Formats, including GeoTIFF, NITF, CADRG, JPEG, JPEG2000, ECW and MrSID\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e Implements Comprehensive OGC Web Processing Service (WPS), Web Coverage Service (WCS), Web Mapping Service (WMS) and Catalog Services for the Web (CS-W)\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1394.jpg","creators_name":"Hexagon Geospatial","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":null,"last_updated":null,"nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1394-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: ERDAS Imagine is a suite of geospatial data authoring software. The suite contains a raster graphics editor and remote sensing application that performs advanced remote sensing analysis and spatial modelling to create new information. ERDAS IMAGINE can also visualize results in 2D, 3D, video, and on cartographic quality map compositions. It is primarily designed for geospatial raster data processing and the creation of digital images for mapping use in GIS or CAD software. Features:  Image Analysis, Remote Sensing Parallel Batch Processing Spatial ModelingHigh Performance Mosaicking Engine in IMAGINE Advantage Expanded Change Detection Tools (with Zonal Change Detection) ERDAS ER Mapper Algorithms Converts over 190 Image Formats to all Major File Formats, including GeoTIFF, NITF, CADRG, JPEG, JPEG2000, ECW and MrSID Implements Comprehensive OGC Web Processing Service (WPS), Web Coverage Service (WCS), Web Mapping Service (WMS) and Catalog Services for the Web (CS-W)
name: Erdas Imagine

data_tapor: {"id":1395,"user_id":1,"name":"QuarkXPress","detail":"\u003cp\u003eQuarkXPress desktop publishing software is commonly used to create page layouts for a variety of print publications such as books, newspapers, magazines, posters and brochures. Similar in function to InDesign, the main differences are Quark's unique features for exporting documents as interactive webpages as well as its widespread use by printers, typesetters and page designers.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eEnables the production of HTML and XML content without the need to convert or refine documents\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSupports direct PDF importing and outputing according to regulations\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFully supports Adobe Photoshop files, avoiding complicated and time-consuming conversions\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eUses OpenType and Unicode, making font and character settings easy\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFree TypeTricks XTension locates overset text boxes as well as widows and orphans\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePresents intuitive colour-management tools that includes the unique option of hexachrome printing\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAllows the customisation of line and border dashes and stripes as well as the merging of boxes to generate complex shapes\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eText runaround for hidden layers may be turned off\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eShared Content instantly incorporates any text or graphic changes consistently throughout a project\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eXPress Composition Zones allow team members to work simulatenously on a project, with all modifications being updated instantly\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eJob jackets keep print job specifications consistent throughout the project, ensuring their clarity and memorability\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1395.jpg","creators_name":"Quark Inc","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://www.quark.com/en/Products/QuarkXPress/","last_updated":"2018-10-05","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1395-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: QuarkXPress desktop publishing software is commonly used to create page layouts for a variety of print publications such as books, newspapers, magazines, posters and brochures. Similar in function to InDesign, the main differences are Quark's unique features for exporting documents as interactive webpages as well as its widespread use by printers, typesetters and page designers.Features: Enables the production of HTML and XML content without the need to convert or refine documentsSupports direct PDF importing and outputing according to regulationsFully supports Adobe Photoshop files, avoiding complicated and time-consuming conversionsUses OpenType and Unicode, making font and character settings easyFree TypeTricks XTension locates overset text boxes as well as widows and orphansPresents intuitive colour-management tools that includes the unique option of hexachrome printingAllows the customisation of line and border dashes and stripes as well as the merging of boxes to generate complex shapesText runaround for hidden layers may be turned offShared Content instantly incorporates any text or graphic changes consistently throughout a projectXPress Composition Zones allow team members to work simulatenously on a project, with all modifications being updated instantlyJob jackets keep print job specifications consistent throughout the project, ensuring their clarity and memorability
name: QuarkXPress

detail: The Entity Authority Tool Set (EATS) is a web application for recording, editing, using and displaying authority information about entities. It is designed to allow multiple authorities to each maintain their own independent data, while operating on a common base so that information about the same entity is all in one place. EATS also comes with client tools for automatically looking up entities in a text by name and adding appropriate TEI markup.Features: A web API for importing and exporting entity dataRobust searching with support for variant name formsSupport for exporting entity data in a variety of formats
name: Eats

data_tapor: {"id":1410,"user_id":1,"name":"Github","detail":"\u003cp\u003eGitHub is a web-based repository service which offers the distributed revision control and source code management (SCM) functionality of GIT with a graphical user interface, desktop, and mobile integration. It also provides collaboration tools such as access control, wikis, task management, code review, bug tracking, and feature requests. It offers free accounts, often used to host opensource software projects, and private (paid) repositories. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eProjects on GitHub can be accessed and manipulated using the git command-line interface and all of the standard git commands work with it. GitHub also allows registered and non-registered users to browse public repositories on the site. Multiple desktop clients have also been created by GitHub and other third parties which integrate with the platform.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGitHub is mainly used for code but can also be used for non-code files, it supports the following formats and features: \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e3D render files \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003ePhotoshop's native PSD format can be previewed and compared to previous versions of the same file.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eNested task-lists\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eDocumentation and wikis\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSmall websites can be hosted from public repositories on GitHub. The URL format is http://projectname.github.io.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIssue tracking (including feature requests)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eVisualization of geospatial data\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGantt charts \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eGitHub is a heavily used in the opensource development community but does not require hosted projects to meet the definition of Open Source.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1410.jpg","creators_name":"GitHub Inc.","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":4.0,"url":"https://github.com/","last_updated":"2018-11-06","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1410-thumb.jpg","rating_count":1,"recipes":""}
detail: GitHub is a web-based repository service which offers the distributed revision control and source code management (SCM) functionality of GIT with a graphical user interface, desktop, and mobile integration. It also provides collaboration tools such as access control, wikis, task management, code review, bug tracking, and feature requests. It offers free accounts, often used to host opensource software projects, and private (paid) repositories. Projects on GitHub can be accessed and manipulated using the git command-line interface and all of the standard git commands work with it. GitHub also allows registered and non-registered users to browse public repositories on the site. Multiple desktop clients have also been created by GitHub and other third parties which integrate with the platform.GitHub is mainly used for code but can also be used for non-code files, it supports the following formats and features: 3D render files Photoshop's native PSD format can be previewed and compared to previous versions of the same file.Nested task-listsDocumentation and wikisSmall websites can be hosted from public repositories on GitHub. The URL format is http://projectname.github.io.Issue tracking (including feature requests)Visualization of geospatial dataGantt charts GitHub is a heavily used in the opensource development community but does not require hosted projects to meet the definition of Open Source.
name: GitHub

data_tapor: {"id":1420,"user_id":1,"name":"Open Conference Systems","detail":"\u003cp\u003eOpen Conference Systems (OCS) is a free Web publishing tool that can create a complete Web presence for scholarly conferences. It is a highly flexible management and publishing system that can be downloaded for free and installed on a local Web server. It has been designed to reduce the time and energy devoted to the clerical and managerial tasks associated with managing a conference, while improving the record-keeping and efficiency of editorial processes. It seeks to improve the scholarly and public quality of conference publishing through a number of innovation, from making policies more transparent to improving indexing. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFeatures:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- create a conference Web site\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- Manage conferences that occur more than once (e.g., yearly)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- compose and send a call for papers\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- electronically accept paper and abstract submissions\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- allow paper submitters to edit their work\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- Conduct peer reviews\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- post conference proceedings and papers in a searchable format\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- Schedule a Conference\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- post the original data sets\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- register participants, including accepting payments\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- integrate post-conference online discussions\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- utilize an e-mail template system\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- support multiple languages with localization files\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- Take advantage of more customizable, scalable and secure code\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eSystem Requirements:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eA server environment meeting the following requirements is recommended:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- PHP \u0026gt;= 4.2.x (including PHP 5.x); Microsoft IIS requires PHP 5.x\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- MySQL \u0026gt;= 3.23.23 (including MySQL 4.x) or PostgreSQL \u0026gt;= 7.1 (including\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- PostgreSQL 8.x)\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e- Apache \u0026gt;= 1.3.2x or \u0026gt;= 2.0.4x or Microsoft IIS 6\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOperating system: Any OS that supports the above software, including\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eLinux, BSD, Solaris, Mac OS X, Windows\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1420.jpg","creators_name":"Public Knowledge Project","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"https://pkp.sfu.ca/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://pkp.sfu.ca/ocs/","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1420-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Open Conference Systems (OCS) is a free Web publishing tool that can create a complete Web presence for scholarly conferences. It is a highly flexible management and publishing system that can be downloaded for free and installed on a local Web server. It has been designed to reduce the time and energy devoted to the clerical and managerial tasks associated with managing a conference, while improving the record-keeping and efficiency of editorial processes. It seeks to improve the scholarly and public quality of conference publishing through a number of innovation, from making policies more transparent to improving indexing. Features:- create a conference Web site- Manage conferences that occur more than once (e.g., yearly)- compose and send a call for papers- electronically accept paper and abstract submissions- allow paper submitters to edit their work- Conduct peer reviews- post conference proceedings and papers in a searchable format- Schedule a Conference- post the original data sets- register participants, including accepting payments- integrate post-conference online discussions- utilize an e-mail template system- support multiple languages with localization files- Take advantage of more customizable, scalable and secure codeSystem Requirements:A server environment meeting the following requirements is recommended:- PHP >= 4.2.x (including PHP 5.x); Microsoft IIS requires PHP 5.x- MySQL >= 3.23.23 (including MySQL 4.x) or PostgreSQL >= 7.1 (including- PostgreSQL 8.x)- Apache >= 1.3.2x or >= 2.0.4x or Microsoft IIS 6Operating system: Any OS that supports the above software, includingLinux, BSD, Solaris, Mac OS X, Windows
name: Open Conference Systems

data_tapor: {"id":1447,"user_id":1,"name":"Omeka.net","detail":"\u003cp\u003eOmeka.net provides a web-publishing platform to curate collections and create exhibitions of digitized content. Omeka.net has grown out of the Omeka project. Omeka.net provides some of the same functionality as Omeka, but does not require the user to provide hosting or to maintain their installation in any way. However, use of Omeka.net limits customization, and hosting more than 500MB of content requires a paid account. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eObjects in the collection can be cataloged with Dublin core metadata fields and georeferenced for display on a map. Omeka.net includes several plugins, including COinS (which makes objects in Omeka accessible to citations management software, like Zotero), HTML5 Media (to play audio and video), and Library of Congress Suggest (which will auto-populate fields with LoC authority and subject headings).\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1447.jpg","creators_name":"Corporation for Digital Scholarship, Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media (CHNM)","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"http://digitalscholar.org/","star_average":4.0,"url":"https://www.omeka.net/","last_updated":"2018-10-05","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1447-thumb.jpg","rating_count":1,"recipes":""}
detail: Omeka.net provides a web-publishing platform to curate collections and create exhibitions of digitized content. Omeka.net has grown out of the Omeka project. Omeka.net provides some of the same functionality as Omeka, but does not require the user to provide hosting or to maintain their installation in any way. However, use of Omeka.net limits customization, and hosting more than 500MB of content requires a paid account. Objects in the collection can be cataloged with Dublin core metadata fields and georeferenced for display on a map. Omeka.net includes several plugins, including COinS (which makes objects in Omeka accessible to citations management software, like Zotero), HTML5 Media (to play audio and video), and Library of Congress Suggest (which will auto-populate fields with LoC authority and subject headings).
name: Omeka S

data_tapor: {"id":1448,"user_id":1,"name":"Omeka","detail":"\u003cp\u003eOmeka is a content management system designed for the display of library, museum, archives, and scholarly collections and exhibitions.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOmeka falls at a crossroads of Web Content Management, Collections Management, and Archival Digital Collections Systems. Omeka is designed with non-IT specialists in mind, allowing users to focus on content and interpretation rather than programming. It brings Web 2.0 technologies and approaches to academic and cultural websites to foster user interaction and participation. It makes top-shelf design easy with a simple and flexible templating system. Its robust open-source developer and user communities underwrite Omeka’s stability and sustainability.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eOmeka allows users to publish cultural heritage objects, extend its functionality with themes and plugins, and curate online exhibits with digital objects.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1448.jpg","creators_name":"Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media (CHNM)","creators_email":null,"creators_url":"http://rrchnm.org/","star_average":5.0,"url":"https://omeka.org/","last_updated":"2018-09-27","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/omeka/Omeka","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1448-thumb.jpg","rating_count":1,"recipes":""}
detail: Omeka is a content management system designed for the display of library, museum, archives, and scholarly collections and exhibitions.Omeka falls at a crossroads of Web Content Management, Collections Management, and Archival Digital Collections Systems. Omeka is designed with non-IT specialists in mind, allowing users to focus on content and interpretation rather than programming. It brings Web 2.0 technologies and approaches to academic and cultural websites to foster user interaction and participation. It makes top-shelf design easy with a simple and flexible templating system. Its robust open-source developer and user communities underwrite Omeka’s stability and sustainability.Omeka allows users to publish cultural heritage objects, extend its functionality with themes and plugins, and curate online exhibits with digital objects.
name: Omeka

detail:
OpenLayers is a Javascript library that can display map tiles and markers loaded from any source in web browser. It provides an API for building rich web-based geographic applications.

OpenLayers makes it easy to put a dynamic map in any web page. It can display map tiles, vector data and markers loaded from any source. OpenLayers has been developed to further the use of geographic information of all kinds. It is completely free, Open Source JavaScript, released under the 2-clause BSD License (also known as the FreeBSD).
name: OpenLayers

data_tapor: {"id":1469,"user_id":1,"name":"CATMA: Computer Aided Textual Markup \u0026 Analysis","detail":"\u003cp\u003eCATMA (Computer Aided Textual Markup \u0026amp; Analysis) is a free, open source markup and analysis tool from the University of Hamburg's Department of Languages, Literature and Media. It incorporates three interactive modules: (1) The tagger enables flexible and individual textual markup and markup editing. (2) The analyzer incorporates a query language and predefined functions. It also includes a query builder that allows users to construct queries from combinations of pre-defined questions while allowing for manual modification for more specific questions. (3) The visualizer provides basic visualization options for texts and corpora. CATMA also interfaces with the Voyant toolset. As of version 4.1, CATMA is a web application with collaborative work functions, and improvements to its user interface, queries and corpus analysis capacity. Version 4.2 offers, among others, new visualization options.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1469.jpg","creators_name":"University of Hamburg (Department of Languages, Literature and Media)","creators_email":null,"creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"http://catma.de/","last_updated":"2018-09-27","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/mpetris/catma","thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1469-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
name_tapor-api: CATMA: Computer Aided Textual Markup & Analysis
detail: CATMA (Computer Aided Textual Markup & Analysis) is a free, open source markup and analysis tool from the University of Hamburg's Department of Languages, Literature and Media. It incorporates three interactive modules: (1) The tagger enables flexible and individual textual markup and markup editing. (2) The analyzer incorporates a query language and predefined functions. It also includes a query builder that allows users to construct queries from combinations of pre-defined questions while allowing for manual modification for more specific questions. (3) The visualizer provides basic visualization options for texts and corpora. CATMA also interfaces with the Voyant toolset. As of version 4.1, CATMA is a web application with collaborative work functions, and improvements to its user interface, queries and corpus analysis capacity. Version 4.2 offers, among others, new visualization options.
name: CATMA

detail: AntConc is free concordance software. It is multi-platform and easy to deploy and use.AntConc is part of a suite of related tools for text processing and analysis, including applications for parallel corpus analysis, word profiling, PDF to text conversion, text structure analysis, detecting and converting character encodings, Japanese and Chinese segmenter and tokenizer, wordclass tagger, and spelling variant anaysis. The developer is currently drafting a more explicit licence for the use of the software.
name: AntConc

detail: Sumo Paint is a free online Flash-based image editor that works in a web browser, without needing to install anything on your device. It has functionality similar to Photoshop and offers many of the same tools but is focused on illustration rather than photo editing. Sumo Paint offers community features such as uploading, commenting, and rating images for users who create free accounts.The paid pro version of the software features a downloadable version of the software which runs on Adobe AIR. Sumo API allows you to embed Sumo Apps to your site. You can integrate Sumo API for free for non-commercial use. Paid subscriptions allow access to the downloadable editor, increased image resolution, enhanced customer support, and early access to new features.Sumo is planning on releasing a photo editor in the near future.
name: Sumo Paint

Picasa has been shut down in favour of Google Photos.
name: Picasa Web Albums

detail: Picasa is an image organizer and viewer for organizing and editing digital photographs that includes an integrated photo-sharing website. For organizing photos Picasa has file importing and tracking features, tagging, facial recognition, and collections for sorting. It offers basic photo editing functions including color enhancement, red eye reduction, cropping, and adding text to images. Other features include slide shows, printing, and image timelines. Picasa does not store the photos you view or edit, it simply looks at folders on your computer to find photos to display. It can display the file types you tell it to from the folders you tell it to search. When editing images in Picasa your original files are never altered. You can choose to save your edits and Picasa will create a new version of the photo, leaving the original intact. Images can be prepared for external use, such as e-mailing or printing, by reducing file size and setting up page layouts. There is also integration with online photo printing services. Picasa uses picasa.ini files and IPTC Information Interchange Model keyword data (JPEG files only) for tracking keywords for each image. The following file types are supported in Picasa (for Windows):Photos: .jpeg, .tif, .tiff, .bmp, .gif, .psd (Photoshop), .png, .tga, and selected RAW formats.Movies: For general playback: .mpg, .mod, .mmv, .tod, .wmv, .asf, .avi, .divx, .mov, .m4v, .3gp, .3g2, .mp4, .m2t, .m2ts, .mts, .mkv. For several of these file types, the correct software is required for playback. For use in Movie Maker: .avi, .asf, .wmv, .mpg, .m2t, .mmv, .m2tsAudio (for slideshows and the Movie Maker): .wma and .mp3 Animated GIF files will not animate in Picasa
name: Picasa

data_tapor: {"id":1498,"user_id":1,"name":"ImageJ","detail":"\u003cp\u003eImageJ is a Java open source image processing program designed for scientific multidimensional images. It is highly extensible, with thousands of plugins and macros for performing a wide variety of tasks, and a strong, established user base.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThere are three major versions of ImageJ:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eImageJ1 - The stable version, developed by Wayne Rasband at NIH since 1997\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eImageJ2 - Focuses on analysis of scientific multidimensional image data. Includes ImageJ1 with a compatibility layer\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFiji - A distribution of ImageJ for the life sciences. It provides a large number of additional plugins to facilitate analysis of life sciences images, particularly microscopy images. Built on the ImageJ2 platform.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/2/1498.jpg","creators_name":"Wayne Rasband","creators_email":"imagej@list.nih.gov","creators_url":null,"star_average":0.0,"url":"https://imagej.nih.gov/ij/","last_updated":"2018-09-18","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":null,"thumb_url":"images/tools/2/1498-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: ImageJ is a Java open source image processing program designed for scientific multidimensional images. It is highly extensible, with thousands of plugins and macros for performing a wide variety of tasks, and a strong, established user base.There are three major versions of ImageJ:ImageJ1 - The stable version, developed by Wayne Rasband at NIH since 1997ImageJ2 - Focuses on analysis of scientific multidimensional image data. Includes ImageJ1 with a compatibility layerFiji - A distribution of ImageJ for the life sciences. It provides a large number of additional plugins to facilitate analysis of life sciences images, particularly microscopy images. Built on the ImageJ2 platform.
name: ImageJ

detail: GIMP is image editing software, much like Photoshop. It is a multi-platform software application primarily used for image composition and editing. The basic tool may be augmented by plug-ins and extensions that allow the use of new file formats, effects filters and batch processing capabilities. GIMP was initially created to manipulate raster images, but has been extended to provide limited vector image and moving image support. A number of free extensions are available in the plugin registry.
name: GIMP

{"id":1509,"user_id":1149,"name":"Datawrapper","detail":"Datawrapper is a tool built to make it easy for journalists and other content-creators to create simple charts and maps for web articles. To make a chart, you paste in your numbers and choose a chart type. We make sure that the chart you’ll embed in your article at the end is beautiful, responsive and interactive.

Our charts feel at home on the web. They’re interactive, responsive and embeddable in your website.

No code or design skills required. The way from data to a beautiful chart is shorter than you think.

1. Copy & Paste your data: Simply copy your data from Excel or Google Sheets. You can also upload CSV files or link to an URL for live-updating charts.

2. Visualize: Choose from many chart and map types with one click. Customize and annotate your chart to make it more effective.

3. Publish your chart: Copy the ready-to-use embed code into your CMS or website, or export the chart as an image or PDF to print it.

detail:

To make a chart, you paste in your numbers and choose a chart type. We make sure that the chart you’ll embed in your article at the end is beautiful, responsive and interactive.

Our charts feel at home on the web. They’re interactive, responsive and embeddable in your website.

No code or design skills required.
The way from data to a beautiful chart is shorter than you think.

1. Copy & Paste your data:
Simply copy your data from Excel or Google Sheets. You can also upload CSV files or link to an URL for live-updating charts.

2. Visualize:
Choose from many chart and map types with one click. Customize and annotate your chart to make it more effective.

3. Publish your chart:
Copy the ready-to-use embed code into your CMS or website, or export the chart as an image or PDF to print it.
name: wrapper

data_tapor:
{"id":1531,"user_id":1149,"name":"Amazon Comprehend","detail":"Amazon Comprehend is a natural language processing (NLP) service that uses machine learning to find insights and relationships in text. No machine learning experience required.

There is a treasure trove of potential sitting in your unstructured data. Customer emails, support tickets, product reviews, social media, even advertising copy represents insights into customer sentiment that can be put to work for your business. The question is how to get at it? As it turns out, Machine learning is particularly good at accurately identifying specific items of interest inside vast swathes of text (such as finding company names in analyst reports), and can learn the sentiment hidden inside language (identifying negative reviews, or positive customer interactions with customer service agents), at almost limitless scale.

Amazon Comprehend uses machine learning to help you uncover the insights and relationships in your unstructured data. The service identifies the language of the text; extracts key phrases, places, people, brands, or events; understands how positive or negative the text is; analyzes text using tokenization and parts of speech; and automatically organizes a collection of text files by topic. You can also use AutoML capabilities in Amazon Comprehend to build a custom set of entities or text classification models that are tailored uniquely to your organization’s needs.

","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1531.jpg","creators_name":"Amazon","creators_email":"","creators_url":"https://www.amazon.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://aws.amazon.com/comprehend/","last_updated":"2018-12-13","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1531-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Amazon Comprehend is a natural language processing (NLP) service that uses machine learning to find insights and relationships in text. No machine learning experience required.

There is a treasure trove of potential sitting in your unstructured data. Customer emails, support tickets, product reviews, social media, even advertising copy represents insights into customer sentiment that can be put to work for your business. The question is how to get at it? As it turns out, Machine learning is particularly good at accurately identifying specific items of interest inside vast swathes of text (such as finding company names in analyst reports), and can learn the sentiment hidden inside language (identifying negative reviews, or positive customer interactions with customer service agents), at almost limitless scale.

Amazon Comprehend uses machine learning to help you uncover the insights and relationships in your unstructured data. The service identifies the language of the text; extracts key phrases, places, people, brands, or events; understands how positive or negative the text is; analyzes text using tokenization and parts of speech; and automatically organizes a collection of text files by topic. You can also use AutoML capabilities in Amazon Comprehend to build a custom set of entities or text classification models that are tailored uniquely to your organization’s needs.
name: Amazon Comprehend

Automatic sentiment analysis of up to 16,000 social web texts per second with up to human level accuracy for English - other languages available or easily added.SentiStrength estimates the strength of positive and negative sentiment in short texts, even for informal language.SentiStrength can also report binary (positive/negative), trinary (positive/negative/neutral) and single scale (-4 to +4) results. SentiStrength was originally developed for English and optimised for general short social web texts but can be configured for other languages and contexts by changing its input files - some variants are demonstrated below.","is_approved":false,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1564.jpg","creators_name":"","creators_email":"","creators_url":"","star_average":0.0,"url":"http://sentistrength.wlv.ac.uk/","last_updated":"2019-09-20","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1564-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}

data_tapor: {"id":1565,"user_id":1201,"name":"SentiStrength","detail":"SentiStrength is a sentiment analysis (opinion mining) program. SentiStrength estimates the strength of positive and negative sentiment in short texts. It is ideal for short texts like tweets.\nThere is an online version and a downloadable Java version which has more options. \nIt is stated to be able to analyse 16,000 tweets per second. To enter multiply short test, each text has to be put on a new line. SentiStrength will give a rating of the positive and negative sentiment strength for each line in a generated text file.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1565.jpg","creators_name":"Mike Thelwall","creators_email":"m.thelwall@wlv.ac.uk","creators_url":"http://sentistrength.wlv.ac.uk","star_average":0.0,"url":"http://sentistrength.wlv.ac.uk/","last_updated":"2019-11-01","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1565-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
SentiStrength is a sentiment analysis (opinion mining) program. SentiStrength estimates the strength of positive and negative sentiment in short texts. It is ideal for short texts like tweets.
There is an online version and a downloadable Java version which has more options. 
It is stated to be able to analyse 16,000 tweets per second. To enter multiply short test, each text has to be put on a new line. SentiStrength will give a rating of the positive and negative sentiment strength for each line in a generated text file.
name: SentiStrength

{"id":1577,"user_id":1201,"name":"CATMA 6.0","detail":"CATMA 6.0 is a free online tool that helps you to annotate, interpret, analyze and visualize text.  CATMA stands for Computer Assisted Text Markup and Analysis. It is an update from CATMA 5. With CATMA 6.0 you can:
-Upload your own corpus and share it with others to work collaboratively.
-Annotate your texts in an undogmatic fashion. Where required: multiple, overlapping, short, extensive, discontinuous or even in contradictory variants can be used.
-Develop your own tagset or import an existing one.
-Choose from several interactive visualizations for your data. There are word clouds, graphs and networks visualizations.","is_approved":false,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1577.jpg","creators_name":"Jan Christoph Meister, Jan Horstmann, Marco Petris, Janina Jacke & Christian Bruck","creators_email":"jan-c-meister@uni-hamburg.de","creators_url":"https://jcmeister.de/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://catma.de","last_updated":"2019-11-17","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/mpetris/catma","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1577-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
CATMA 6.0 is a free online tool that helps you to annotate, interpret, analyze and visualize text.  CATMA stands for Computer Assisted Text Markup and Analysis. It is an update from CATMA 5. With CATMA 6.0 you can:
-Upload your own corpus and share it with others to work collaboratively.
-Annotate your texts in an undogmatic fashion. Where required: multiple, overlapping, short, extensive, discontinuous or even in contradictory variants can be used.
-Develop your own tagset or import an existing one.
-Choose from several interactive visualizations for your data. There are word clouds, graphs and networks visualizations.
name: CATMA

data_tapor: {"id":1583,"user_id":1201,"name":"UDPipe","detail":"UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files. UDPipe is language-agnostic and can be trained given annotated data in CoNLL-U format. Trained models are provided for nearly all UD treebanks. UDPipe is available as a binary for Linux/Windows/OS X, as a library for C++, Python, Perl, Java, C#, and as a web service. Third-party R CRAN package also exists.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1583.jpg","creators_name":"Institute of Formal and Applied Linguistics, Charles University, Czech Republic","creators_email":"straka@ufal.mff.cuni.cz","creators_url":"http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/udpipe","star_average":0.0,"url":"http://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/udpipe/","last_updated":"2019-12-11","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"http://github.com/ufal/udpipe","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1583-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: UDPipe is a trainable pipeline for tokenization, tagging, lemmatization and dependency parsing of CoNLL-U files. UDPipe is language-agnostic and can be trained given annotated data in CoNLL-U format. Trained models are provided for nearly all UD treebanks. UDPipe is available as a binary for Linux/Windows/OS X, as a library for C++, Python, Perl, Java, C#, and as a web service. Third-party R CRAN package also exists.
name: UDPipe

InVisionapp is basically a prototyping tool that allows you to create clickable versions of your design.

It works in early stages of your projects, when you have still mockups, or to create minimum viable product (MVP) to test or to present to customers.
InVisionapp is very advanced, it allows you also to share projects with your team, comment screens, create animations and transitions and interact with most common design tools as Sketch and Photoshop.
name: InVision

data_tapor: {"id":1603,"user_id":1201,"name":"spaCy","detail":"spaCy is an open-source software library for advanced natural language processing, written in the programming languages Python and Cython. The library is published under the MIT license and currently offers statistical neural network models for English, German, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Italian, Dutch and multi-language NER, as well as tokenization for various other languages.\n\nUnlike NLTK, which is widely used for teaching and research, spaCy focuses on providing software for production usage. As of version 1.0, spaCy also supports deep learning workflows that allow connecting statistical models trained by popular machine learning libraries like TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn or PyTorch. spaCy's machine learning library, Thinc, is also available as a separate open-source Python library. It features convolutional neural network models for part-of-speech tagging, dependency parsing and named entity recognition, as well as API improvements around training and updating models, and constructing custom processing pipelines.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1603.jpg","creators_name":"Matthew Honnibal","creators_email":"","creators_url":"","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://spacy.io/","last_updated":"2020-02-07","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/explosion/spaCy","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1603-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
spaCy is an open-source software library for advanced natural language processing, written in the programming languages Python and Cython. The library is published under the MIT license and currently offers statistical neural network models for English, German, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Italian, Dutch and multi-language NER, as well as tokenization for various other languages.

Unlike NLTK, which is widely used for teaching and research, spaCy focuses on providing software for production usage. As of version 1.0, spaCy also supports deep learning workflows that allow connecting statistical models trained by popular machine learning libraries like TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn or PyTorch. spaCy's machine learning library, Thinc, is also available as a separate open-source Python library. It features convolutional neural network models for part-of-speech tagging, dependency parsing and named entity recognition, as well as API improvements around training and updating models, and constructing custom processing pipelines.
name: SpaCy

data_tapor: {"id":1606,"user_id":1201,"name":"gensim","detail":"Gensim is an open-source library for unsupervised topic modeling and natural language processing, using modern statistical machine learning.\nGensim is implemented in Python and Cython. Gensim is designed to handle large text collections using data streaming and incremental online algorithms, which differentiates it from most other machine learning software packages that target only in-memory processing. Gensim includes streamed parallelized implementations of fastText, word2vec and doc2vec algorithms, as well as latent semantic analysis (LSA, LSI, SVD), non-negative matrix factorization (NMF), latent Dirichlet allocation (LDA), tf-idf and random projections.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1606.jpg","creators_name":"Radim Řehůřek","creators_email":"me@radimrehurek.com","creators_url":"https://radimrehurek.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://radimrehurek.com/gensim/","last_updated":"2020-02-07","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/piskvorky/gensim","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1606-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Gensim is an open-source library for unsupervised topic modeling and natural language processing, using modern statistical machine learning.
Gensim is implemented in Python and Cython. Gensim is designed to handle large text collections using data streaming and incremental online algorithms, which differentiates it from most other machine learning software packages that target only in-memory processing. Gensim includes streamed parallelized implementations of fastText, word2vec and doc2vec algorithms, as well as latent semantic analysis (LSA, LSI, SVD), non-negative matrix factorization (NMF), latent Dirichlet allocation (LDA), tf-idf and random projections.
name: Gensim

data_tapor: {"id":1612,"user_id":1201,"name":"Archivematica","detail":"Archivematica is a web- and standards-based, open-source application which allows your institution to preserve long-term access to trustworthy, authentic and reliable digital content.\nArchivematica is an integrated suite of open-source software tools that allows users to process digital objects from ingest to access in compliance with the ISO-OAIS functional model. Users monitor and control ingest and preservation micro-services via a web-based dashboard. Archivematica uses METS, PREMIS, Dublin Core, the Library of Congress BagIt specification and other recognized standards to generate trustworthy, authentic, reliable and system-independent Archival Information Packages (AIPs) for storage in your preferred repository.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1612.jpg","creators_name":"Artefactual","creators_email":"info@artefactual.com","creators_url":"http://www.artefactual.com","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.archivematica.org/en/","last_updated":"2020-02-17","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://github.com/artefactual","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1612-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Archivematica is a web- and standards-based, open-source application which allows your institution to preserve long-term access to trustworthy, authentic and reliable digital content.
Archivematica is an integrated suite of open-source software tools that allows users to process digital objects from ingest to access in compliance with the ISO-OAIS functional model. Users monitor and control ingest and preservation micro-services via a web-based dashboard. Archivematica uses METS, PREMIS, Dublin Core, the Library of Congress BagIt specification and other recognized standards to generate trustworthy, authentic, reliable and system-independent Archival Information Packages (AIPs) for storage in your preferred repository.
name: Archivematica

data_tapor: {"id":1618,"user_id":1201,"name":"Layar","detail":"The Layar Reality Browser is a free iPhone or Android augmented reality app that lets users look through their mobile device's camera to see “real time digital information (layers) on top of reality.” Some examples of layers are Architecture 3D, Foursquare, Google local search, Trulia, Twitter, Wikipedia and Yellowpages. The app itself is an augmented reality browser and users must download specific layers in order to view and access content. Most layers are free downloads, others cost around $2.00.\nIndividuals and businesses can use Layar to add links, videos, audio, etc to their flyers, logos or products. The product is scanned with a mobile phone camera through the Layar app.\nThe company seems to be bankrupted and Layar might not be in further development.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1618.jpg","creators_name":"Blippar Group","creators_email":"","creators_url":"","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.layar.com/","last_updated":"2020-02-17","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1618-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
The Layar Reality Browser is a free iPhone or Android augmented reality app that lets users look through their mobile device's camera to see “real time digital information (layers) on top of reality.” Some examples of layers are Architecture 3D, Foursquare, Google local search, Trulia, Twitter, Wikipedia and Yellowpages. The app itself is an augmented reality browser and users must download specific layers in order to view and access content. Most layers are free downloads, others cost around $2.00.
Individuals and businesses can use Layar to add links, videos, audio, etc to their flyers, logos or products. The product is scanned with a mobile phone camera through the Layar app.
The company seems to be bankrupted and Layar might not be in further development.
name: Layar

data_tapor:
{"id":1634,"user_id":1201,"name":"Sketch Engine","detail":"Sketch Engine is a tool to explore how language works. Its algorithms analyze authentic texts of billions of words (text corpora) to identify instantly what is typical in language and what is rare, unusual or emerging usage. It is also designed for text analysis or text mining applications.

Sketch Engine is used by linguists, lexicographers, translators, students and teachers. It is a first choice solution for publishers, universities, translation agencies and national language institutes throughout the world.

Sketch Engine contains 500 ready-to-use corpora in 90+ languages, each having a size of up to 30 billion words to provide a truly representative sample of language.

Some of its functions are: word sketch, sketch difference, thesaurus, concordance, parallel concordance, wordlist, n-grams, keywords & terms, bilingual term extractiontrends and OneClick Dictionary.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1634.jpg","creators_name":"Lexical Computing","creators_email":"inquiries@lexicalcomputing.com","creators_url":"","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.sketchengine.eu/","last_updated":"2021-03-26","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1634-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Sketch Engine is a tool to explore how language works. Its algorithms analyze authentic texts of billions of words (text corpora) to identify instantly what is typical in language and what is rare, unusual or emerging usage. It is also designed for text analysis or text mining applications.

Sketch Engine is used by linguists, lexicographers, translators, students and teachers. It is a first choice solution for publishers, universities, translation agencies and national language institutes throughout the world.

Sketch Engine contains 500 ready-to-use corpora in 90+ languages, each having a size of up to 30 billion words to provide a truly representative sample of language.

Some of its functions are: word sketch, sketch difference, thesaurus, concordance, parallel concordance, wordlist, n-grams, keywords & terms, bilingual term extractiontrends and OneClick Dictionary.
name: Sketch Engine

data_tapor: {"id":1646,"user_id":1201,"name":"TreeTagger","detail":"The TreeTagger is a program developed by Helmut Schmid at the University of Stuttgart (now at the University of München), for part-of-speech tagging and lemmatization. Language models (known as “parameters”, file extension .par) are supplied on the TreeTagger webpage for using the program with texts in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Russian, Bulgarian, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, Galician, Latin, Mongolian, Polish, Slovak and Swahili, and models for some other languages are available from sites linked to the TreeTagger webpage. For a language for which no model exists, it is necessary to hand-tag some text, and then run a training program (provided with the TreeTagger) to create the model.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1646.jpg","creators_name":"Helmut Schmid","creators_email":"LastName@cis.lmu.de","creators_url":"https://www.cis.uni-muenchen.de/~schmid/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.cis.uni-muenchen.de/~schmid/tools/TreeTagger/","last_updated":"2021-01-21","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"http://www.smo.uhi.ac.uk/~oduibhin/oideasra/interfaces/winttinterface.htm","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1646-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: The TreeTagger is a program developed by Helmut Schmid at the University of Stuttgart (now at the University of München), for part-of-speech tagging and lemmatization. Language models (known as “parameters”, file extension .par) are supplied on the TreeTagger webpage for using the program with texts in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Russian, Bulgarian, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, Galician, Latin, Mongolian, Polish, Slovak and Swahili, and models for some other languages are available from sites linked to the TreeTagger webpage. For a language for which no model exists, it is necessary to hand-tag some text, and then run a training program (provided with the TreeTagger) to create the model.
name: TreeTagger

{"id":1673,"user_id":1201,"name":"Recoll","detail":"Recoll is used to search for documents based on their content as well as thier filenames.
Recoll can search documents on many different formats and from a variety of storages (files, archive members, email attachments, etc while transparently handling decompression.
It is free on Linux, open source, and licensed under the GPL.
It is based on the very capable Xapian search engine library, for which it provides a powerful text extraction layer and a complete, yet easy to use, Qt graphical interface.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1673.jpg","creators_name":"Jean-Francois Dockes","creators_email":"jfd@recoll.org","creators_url":"https://www.lesbonscomptes.com/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.lesbonscomptes.com/recoll/","last_updated":"2021-08-13","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"https://framagit.org/medoc92/recoll","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1673-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Recoll is used to search for documents based on their content as well as thier filenames.
Recoll can search documents on many different formats and from a variety of storages (files, archive members, email attachments, etc while transparently handling decompression.
It is free on Linux, open source, and licensed under the GPL.
It is based on the very capable Xapian search engine library, for which it provides a powerful text extraction layer and a complete, yet easy to use, Qt graphical interface.
name: Recoll

detail: Sonic Visualiser is a free, open-source application for Windows, Linux, and Mac, designed to study a music recording closely. It's designed for musicologists, archivists, signal-processing researchers, and anyone else looking for a friendly way to look at what lies inside the audio file. Its latest release was September 2021. Its main functions are visualisation, analysis, and annotation of music audio recordings.
name: Sonic Visualiser

data_tapor: {"id":1702,"user_id":1364,"name":"Rekhta","detail":"\u003cp\u003eEstablished with the aim of disseminating and promoting Urdu literature, with a focus on poetry, Rekhta.org is a free website with archival material available in Roman and Devnagari script along with the Urdu script. The website has a large number of features that make it extremely user-friendly and provides the reader unparalleled convenience in the ability to browse, search and find relevant content with its customized powerful search facility. The website allows one to see the translation as well as transliteration of Urdu words to Hindi and English. It also has the unique feature of an in-built glossary that provides the meaning of every word at just a click. In order to give the uninitiated reader a flavour of the diction and pronunciation, a large number of compositions have been recorded in the voice of poets and professionals and have been provided along with the text. The website also has an Urdu dictionary. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt has started a section of Urdu Shayari for beginners wherein newcomers to the world of Urdu poetry are introduced to relatively easy poetry as well as popular Ghazals and Nazms along with videos of these compositions sung and recited by well known artists and poets. It has also started an initiative to digitize Urdu literature, both poetry and prose, in order to preserve rare and popular Urdu books.  Apart from sourcing books from personal collections of various people, it has also associated with reputed libraries and organizations to digitize their collections.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":false,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1702.jpg","creators_name":"Sanjiv Saraf","creators_email":"","creators_url":"","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.rekhta.org/","last_updated":"2022-05-06","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1702-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Established with the aim of disseminating and promoting Urdu literature, with a focus on poetry, Rekhta.org is a free website with archival material available in Roman and Devnagari script along with the Urdu script. The website has a large number of features that make it extremely user-friendly and provides the reader unparalleled convenience in the ability to browse, search and find relevant content with its customized powerful search facility. The website allows one to see the translation as well as transliteration of Urdu words to Hindi and English. It also has the unique feature of an in-built glossary that provides the meaning of every word at just a click. In order to give the uninitiated reader a flavour of the diction and pronunciation, a large number of compositions have been recorded in the voice of poets and professionals and have been provided along with the text. The website also has an Urdu dictionary. 
It has started a section of Urdu Shayari for beginners wherein newcomers to the world of Urdu poetry are introduced to relatively easy poetry as well as popular Ghazals and Nazms along with videos of these compositions sung and recited by well known artists and poets. It has also started an initiative to digitize Urdu literature, both poetry and prose, in order to preserve rare and popular Urdu books.  Apart from sourcing books from personal collections of various people, it has also associated with reputed libraries and organizations to digitize their collections.
name: Rekhta

data_tapor: {"id":1703,"user_id":1364,"name":"Rekhta Dictionary","detail":"\u003cp\u003eRekhta Dictionary is a new initiative of Rekhta Foundation for the promotion and preservation of Urdu language and literature. Since 2011, the Foundation has been running multiple websites including Rekhta, Sufinama, Hindwi, and Aamozish.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Rekhta Dictionary is a comprehensive collection of Urdu words with their meanings in Urdu, Hindi and English. The words can easily be accessed in three scripts through a high-functioning search engine. Along with detailed meanings, it gives the list of synonyms, antonyms, proverbs, idioms and much more.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis trilingual Urdu dictionary is designed as a resourceful tool for the researchers, poetry-lovers, and general readers irrespective of their familiarity with Urdu script.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":false,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1703.jpg","creators_name":"Sanjiv Saraf","creators_email":"","creators_url":"","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://rekhtadictionary.com/","last_updated":"2022-05-06","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1703-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
Rekhta Dictionary is a new initiative of Rekhta Foundation for the promotion and preservation of Urdu language and literature. Since 2011, the Foundation has been running multiple websites including Rekhta, Sufinama, Hindwi, and Aamozish.
The Rekhta Dictionary is a comprehensive collection of Urdu words with their meanings in Urdu, Hindi and English. The words can easily be accessed in three scripts through a high-functioning search engine. Along with detailed meanings, it gives the list of synonyms, antonyms, proverbs, idioms and much more.
This trilingual Urdu dictionary is designed as a resourceful tool for the researchers, poetry-lovers, and general readers irrespective of their familiarity with Urdu script.
name: Rekhta Dictionary

data_tapor: {"id":1705,"user_id":1364,"name":"1947 Partition Archive","detail":"\u003cp\u003e A crowdsourced community-based archive, 1947 Partition Archive has been documenting the people's history of the 1947 Partition since 2010. The year 1947 marked the end of British Raj in South Asia and the formation of modern India, Pakistan and (since 1971) Bangladesh, via the Partition of Punjab and Bengal, a globally disruptive event that created one of the largest mass refugee crises of the last century.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe archive has a mapping tool where one can search for persons migrating to and from certain cities during the partition and also zoom in to read their oral histories.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e They have recorded over 10,200 witness oral histories from 14 countries in over 36 languages and dialects, including digital copies of antiquated photographs, documents and images of personal objects of historical value, gathered from personal collections.\u003c/p\u003e","is_approved":false,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1705.jpg","creators_name":"","creators_email":"","creators_url":"","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://in.1947partitionarchive.org/","last_updated":"2022-05-06","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1705-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail:
A crowdsourced community-based archive, 1947 Partition Archive has been documenting the people's history of the 1947 Partition since 2010. The year 1947 marked the end of British Raj in South Asia and the formation of modern India, Pakistan and (since 1971) Bangladesh, via the Partition of Punjab and Bengal, a globally disruptive event that created one of the largest mass refugee crises of the last century.
The archive has a mapping tool where one can search for persons migrating to and from certain cities during the partition and also zoom in to read their oral histories.
 They have recorded over 10,200 witness oral histories from 14 countries in over 36 languages and dialects, including digital copies of antiquated photographs, documents and images of personal objects of historical value, gathered from personal collections.
name: The 1947 Partition Archive

data_tapor: {"id":1708,"user_id":1201,"name":"PubPub","detail":"PubPub is a free open source publishing website. Its aim is to facilitate the creation and publishing of knowledge. It is an open-source, hosted, free-to-use content management system designed to help knowledge communities of all types collaboratively create and share knowledge online. PubPub’s flexible, extensible system allows communities to create the dynamic content that best represents their work, whether it’s a traditional academic journal, a book, a repository of interactive documents, a blog, all of the above, or something in between. If needed, PubPub then helps communities integrate their work into academic infrastructure like Crossref and Google Scholar without the need to remake it to conform to legacy expectations of how academic outputs are structured.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1708.jpg","creators_name":"Knowledge Futures Group","creators_email":"","creators_url":"https://www.knowledgefutures.org/","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://www.pubpub.org/","last_updated":"2022-07-06","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1708-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: PubPub is a free open source publishing website. Its aim is to facilitate the creation and publishing of knowledge. It is an open-source, hosted, free-to-use content management system designed to help knowledge communities of all types collaboratively create and share knowledge online. PubPub’s flexible, extensible system allows communities to create the dynamic content that best represents their work, whether it’s a traditional academic journal, a book, a repository of interactive documents, a blog, all of the above, or something in between. If needed, PubPub then helps communities integrate their work into academic infrastructure like Crossref and Google Scholar without the need to remake it to conform to legacy expectations of how academic outputs are structured.
name: PubPub.org

data_tapor: {"id":1709,"user_id":1201,"name":"Reviews in Digital Humanities (RDH)","detail":"Reviews in Digital Humanities is a pilot of a peer-reviewed journal that facilitates scholarly evaluation of digital humanities work and its outputs. This may include, but is not limited to: digital archives, multimedia or multimodal scholarship, digital exhibits, visualizations, digital games, digital tools, and digital projects. The journal is hosted by PubPub. The journal responds to the challenge of the growth of the number and scale of digital projects outpacing review opportunities in existing journals. As such, it intervenes by bridging a gap in the evaluation of digital projects by arranging for peer review of digital scholarship. Project creators can submit their projects for review.\u003cbr\u003eRDH publishes monthly issues with an average of 5 reviews per issue.\u003cbr\u003eIt also contains a registry of projects, some of which have not yet been reviewed.\u003cbr\u003eAs of June 2022, Reviews in Digital Humanities has more than 76,800 page views, with 17,350+ unique users from 124 countries. Among fields of study for the projects we have reviewed, 30% of projects are in African diaspora studies, 21% are in Latinx studies, 9% are in Global Indigenous studies, and 19% are in Queer studies. The remaining 21% come from a variety of fields.","is_approved":true,"image_url":"images/tools/3/1709.jpg","creators_name":"Dr. Jennifer Guiliano and Dr. Roopika Risam (editors)","creators_email":"","creators_url":"","star_average":0.0,"url":"https://reviewsindh.pubpub.org/","last_updated":"2022-07-07","nature":"tool","language":null,"code":null,"repository":"","thumb_url":"images/tools/3/1709-thumb.jpg","rating_count":0,"recipes":""}
detail: Reviews in Digital Humanities is a pilot of a peer-reviewed journal that facilitates scholarly evaluation of digital humanities work and its outputs. This may include, but is not limited to: digital archives, multimedia or multimodal scholarship, digital exhibits, visualizations, digital games, digital tools, and digital projects. The journal is hosted by PubPub. The journal responds to the challenge of the growth of the number and scale of digital projects outpacing review opportunities in existing journals. As such, it intervenes by bridging a gap in the evaluation of digital projects by arranging for peer review of digital scholarship. Project creators can submit their projects for review.RDH publishes monthly issues with an average of 5 reviews per issue.It also contains a registry of projects, some of which have not yet been reviewed.As of June 2022, Reviews in Digital Humanities has more than 76,800 page views, with 17,350+ unique users from 124 countries. Among fields of study for the projects we have reviewed, 30% of projects are in African diaspora studies, 21% are in Latinx studies, 9% are in Global Indigenous studies, and 19% are in Queer studies. The remaining 21% come from a variety of fields.
name: Reviews in Digital Humanities
